description:
Love coming here to satiate my chai cravings! Dirty chais are my fave for when I need an extra pickmeup boost during the day. 

I've tried the Tiger, Elephant, and White Shark chai teas & the chai flight. The flight wasn't my favorite - I would recommend going for one of the listed above instead. The menu shows you the level of sweet and spicy for each of the drinks, which is really handy. 

Elephant is great for people who love more sweetness, Tiger is the standard but still a little more on the sweet side. The White Shark is my favorite since it's has a nice balance of sweet and spicy! Add a little espresso and it's perfect!

It's also a nice space to relax and get some work done.
author: Miranda N.

description:
How many restrooms do you have available for customers?

On Oct 10, 2018 I found a sign on the door of the farthest restroom "Sorry, out of service". I watched an employee go into the restroom, heard the toilet flush, and leave the restroom. As I tried to enter afterwards, she said "Oh, sorry, it's out of service." I said "I just heard the toilet flush." Another employee said "That one is just for us, it is bad with toilet paper." I said "I won't use any toilet paper!" and was then ignored as the employees walked off.

If the toilet actually has an issue, I would suggest changing the sign to "No toilet paper use in this restroom", fixing it, and then removing the sign.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
Staff: really nice people who seems to engage their customers in conversation
Menu: intense aka a lot of options and a lot of combinations 
We ordered: something chocolate chai something (SORRY! My friend got it). It's really good! At first, the consistency in the cup looks really thick, almost like a smoothie. But the taste is actually quite smooth with a taste of chai which gives it a little amazingness. 
Environment: We went on a Friday evening and it is pretty packed. There are a lot of seatings (but still packed) from couches to long tables to window aisle tables. There are also a handful of outdoor seatings which are great when the weather is nice. Bathroom needs code so it's kept very clean!
author: Yuan Z.

description: Wow!! David Rio certainly knows his chai, and his chai teas are out of this world! Packed full of flavor and boldly partying it up on your taste buds, I thoroughly enjoyed my Orca chai; in fact, I couldn't even tell that it was made without sugar or additional milk! I will definitely add an espresso shot or two next time...if you like cinnamon and chai, this is most definitely the place for you to try!
author: Monica L.

description: Wow, I can't believe I've never had Chai before. Is all Chai this great? I had the Tiger Chai, which to be honest was a bit sweet for me, but I had no idea if I'd even like it. It was delicious though! How is there only one of these? There's also plenty of place to work and I asked them how busy they usually were. Sounds like it's mostly during the weekdays when they get busy. However, there's always seating it sounds like. Most people are just picking up their Chai. Also, for those Oatly fans out there like me. They have it on their menu, but unfortunately it was not available when I went. Overall, highly recommend this place, it's so tasty! I wonder if the Chai they sell for you to make at home is just as good. I'll have to order some sooner than later.
author: Julie L.

description:
I was wandering around by my hotel in SF and had some time to kill before meeting up with a friend. I passed Chai Bar earlier and decided to stop in to see what they're all about. You may have guessed, but they're all about chai! I really like chai but haven't had much experience with different types of this spiced beverage. The menu is large and easy to read with indicators that show how sweet vs. spicy each type of chai is. They also have fun add-ons like espresso, chocolate flavors, and boba! I asked the girl at the counter for some suggestions and she helped me pick the Elephant vanilla chai with boba. They also have beer, wine, coffee drinks, other teas, and food items.

My chai was sweet but not too sweet, with a tasty vanilla flavor and chewy boba pearls. I got it iced of course, but you can get them hot too. The interior of Chai Bar is cozy with a long curvy banquette bench and lots of seating, including outdoor seating in front. I sat at the front window and did some people watching while enjoying my tea - definitely a nice way to spend a leisurely weekend morning!
author: Katy C.

description:
I love chai latte from David Rio! 

I don't like my drink with much sugar. When I drink chai, I would love to taste all the spices. With sugar, everything gets covered. I am so happy that David Rio offers no sugar chai -- boldly spice chai. You can drink it plain with just water or add milk. Talking about milk, this place offers a wide range of milk: from nonfat, 2%, whole milk to almond, soy, macadamia nut, and oat milk. It basically accommodates all sorts of food allergies. 

If you are in the city and are craving for a cup of hot spicy drinks, David Rio is the place to go!! :D
author: Clare L.

description:
Spiced up Chai for the win! 

When one is looking for non-coffee because one has already had their caffeine, this is the place to be! 

Space is adequate and chai products to be brought if one wants to take it go to make at home.  

Lovely chai tea variety and adorned with the spices!

A cup of joy!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
A whole cafe dedicated to chai!  And there's even beer on tap and food.

The menu is easy to read with a short description of the type of flavor of each drink, and it's displayed right at the entrance.  They have many options to add on, such as iced/hot, boba, espresso, etc, and a large selection of different types of milks as well.

I went with the Elephant Vanilla Chai in a 12 oz. cup ($4.50), which has Madagascar vanilla and honey.  I absolutely loved the froth and the spices in this one.  It was a good sweetness, so I did not need to add anything!  It gave me a warm cozy feeling drinking this on a nice afternoon :)

Loved the floors and wire animal artwork supporting animals and wildlife!  There was ample space and it was a nice break from the bustling downtown streets.  There's also free wifi!  The barista who took my order and made my drink was friendly and prompt.  I'll be back here again soon to try more drinks and you should give them a taste as well!
author: Stephanie Z.

description: I love the dirty Tiger Spice chai. ($5.25 with 2 espresso shots) Smooth, lightly sweet, perfect combo of chai, espresso and milk, which can be changed to soy or whole milk.
author: Thomas L.

description:
Highly recommend the Tiger Chai. So smooth and flavorful. Absolutely delicious!

We were greeted with a friendly smile as we dashed in the door in seek of a refuge from the chill wind. We needed to finish planning our afternoon and still weighed heavy from an indulgent meal at Brenda's.

After a quick look at the menu, I played it coy with a large brew of the day. My wife, took the opportunity focus on the core offerings and selected the Tiger Chai with Almond milk. Both were prepared quickly and while my coffee did the trick, the Tiger Chai absolutely hit it out of the park with a rich aroma beginning each sip followed by a perfectly favored creamy taste.

I'm wrapping up my coffee now and will be grabbing a Tiger Chai to go.
author: Ryan P.

description:
I'm a really picky Chai drinker cause I normally do not like it because I'm a coffee person. However, David Rio Chai Bar is the only place I'll buy a cup. The blends are perfect and they also have a healthy food options. 

But let's talk about the space! It's huge and with the chaos that's sits right outside the doors, the space is very chill.
author: Theresa D.

description:
I've come here a few times to work and get out of my office when I'm in a work rut. I really appreciate the large seating area and that there isn't pressure to leave if you've been there for a certain amount of time. 

As for the drinks, who knew there could be so many options for a chai latte?? I've tried about four different drinks and all of them have been satisfying and tasty. I did prefer that more minimal drinks since some of them were a little on the sweeter side for me. 

The only thing I question is whether they actually brew the chai right there or if they just use their premade mix? They are a bit pricey for what you get, but I think its pretty comparable to starbucks, blue bottle, etc. for a latte.
author: Erica C.

description:
I wanted to go to a coffee shop where there was plentiful of seating and wifi. I mean, really, every coffee shop in San Francisco had wifi, but I decided to try something new. I looked around and found this place.

I ordered a Chai cortado, 8 oz. It was pretty good, but the prices were a little out there. But, knowing that it's San Francisco, nothing really comes cheap. The drink came and it was nice, there's nothing bad to say about what they serve here. It's quite simple. The difference between this place and others is that the inside is super spacious. I mean, there's chairs, lounges, they even have a bar. 

If you wanted space to relax or study, this would be a top contender for me if I was living nearby. The staff was really relaxed and it seemed like the whole atmosphere was based around that. If you need a place to study, check this place out.
author: Bruce K.

description: Stopped by this big cafe on Market and was pleasantly surprised to find it focused on Chai drinks both cold, hot and icy. I ordered the Chocolate Chai and was so happy I did. It's one of those drinks you just sip and savor each taste and can tell the quality of the ingredients. There are also snacks and pastries for sale. Will definitely return next time I am in the area.
author: Tu-Quyen P.

description:
I suspect they don't get as much foot traffic as they should based on the neighborhood they are in. I walked from bustling Powell and after crossing the street onto their block, the streets had emptied and definitely felt shadier.

But David Rio Chai Bar is great! Ethnic decor, open space seating (but hard to find outlets), and very friendly baristas. My server took the time to let me sample the hazelnut milk and had suggestions for pairings. They were out of macadamia nut milk that day, but I was pleasantly surprised they even offer that option.

I got the cub chai, which is spicier than the normal chai and less sweet. For those that are lactose intolerant, it tastes great with soy milk! They also offer regular coffee, green tea lattes, boba, and food if chai isn't your thing. But they are specialists in chai, so why not try a cup?
author: Lily C.

description:
Yay. Love this place. They bravely pioneered this block of Market several years ago and at least some of us who go regularly to the San Francisco AIDS Foundation were truly grateful. 

Try a boldly spiced chai. Savor a cub chai. Order with almond milk. I'm not lactose intolerant but chai with almond milk just tastes really good.
author: Tim P.

description:
I came here with a coworker to chat about work. The Chai Bar is popping, even on a Wednesday afternoon around 4:30. There's plenty of seating, but most of it is taken. This place seems like a fun place to do non-intensive work, as there's always a conversation buzz. The line wasn't too long at this time, and we got our drinks within 5 minutes. 

My coworker went for the classic Tiger Spice Chai, and I went for it sugar-free counterpart, the Orca Spice Chai. I found it tasty but not sweet enough -- I guess this is why most go for the Tiger Spice over the Orca Spice. I'd like to try different chais in the future, but at around $5 a cup it'll be just a treat once in a while.
author: Rahul R.

description:
Pretty cool coffee place dedicated to my favorite drink- chai. They have a chai "flight" where you can try 4 of their chai the tiger spice, white shark,  power, and sir spice a lot. 
tiger spice- 5 stars, very flavorful chai, my favorite of the 4
White shark- 3 stars, a more mild version of the tiger spice
Power- 3.5 stars, mild tasting with the spices kicking in when you finish the drink
Sir spice a lot- 3 stars,  mild with a aftertaste
author: Jenny J.

description:
I was obsessed with their four different kinds of chai at a local coffeeshop (Cream Whiskers) in Austin, and I was elated when I found the chai mix they used at Central Market...it was David Rio chai! 

Then I went to San Francisco, and of course I had to stop by the chai bar. There's a big variety of chai to pick from with different levels of spicy vs sweet. The shop is spacious with lots of seating and tables and the staff is friendly. The only reason they don't get give stars is because they use corn syrup :(
author: Jessica Z.

description: Wow, this is absolutely one of the BEST spots to get chai tea at! It's so rich in taste and fragrance, that it's got me wanting for more! David, you should definitely open a location in NYC, I think it'll be poppinnn!
author: Elise L.

description:
What I ordered: Chai flight
Visit date: April 29, 2018
First time? Yes.

I can't say I'm a huge fan of the tea, but I did enjoy the experience. I loved the tiled floor, the local art on the walls, and the friendly staff. Hubby and I ordered the chai flight to share, which comes with a pre-selected set of four chais and a snack (animal crackers! - so cute!). You have to get the chai warm (no choice), but you can pick your milk - we tried ours with soy milk. 

The flight comes with the Tiger Spice Chai, the White Shark Chai (white tea, pepper, citrus), the Power Chai (black tea, Nishio Japanese matcha, spices), and the Sir Spice-a-lot (a blend of their Boldy Spice Chai and Cub Chai). The flight comes in little mugs - adorbs! I was thinking I'd order a full order of my favorite chai, but I wasn't super impressed by any of them. It would have been much more appealing if you could select the chai you wanted to sample and if you could also experience them iced, but that's just how they do it here.
author: Erin G.

description: Generally I'm a coffee girl, but somehow they've converted me into a tea girl. Come here when you have the time. It's worth it.
author: Elizabeth C.

description: I was in town for the weekend and stopped by the flying falafel for lunch when I walked by this place on my way back. The weather was a little cold that day so I decided to stop in. There are large signs hanging right when you walk in that have the different type of drinks they offer. I had decided to pick one of the signature chai lattes but the employee at the register was very friendly and knowledgeable about the different flavorings. As someone who does not like my chai too sweet I decided to order the tiger spice chai. They also offer several of the chai's in decaf and also have a variety of milk options including several non-dairy milks. The flavor guide was perfect in describing the taste as the tiger spice chai was not too sweet and I could still appreciate the spices. I opted for the whole milk and the chai was excellent. I had ordered mine to go but they do have outdoor and indoor seating. I will be back the next time I am in SF
author: Dave S.

description:
I have been here for a special event so it was kind of packed but the place has a interesting vibe to it. I'm not into chai so it's hard for me to rule over that. 
But they serve a descend good coffee. When I am around again I will definitively try again what else they had to offer.
author: Martin W.

description:
TRY THE OATMILK! 

Super creamy and delicious. I had the White Elephant chai with oatmilk. I'm not vegan by any means, but this oatmilk can most definitely turn me into a non-milk drinker from now on. The chai was also delicious, a little subtler than I would like, but then again, there are more heavily spiced options. Love this place. New go to place for an afternoon boost.
author: Jessica L.

description:
Stopped by with a friend to chat over chai. I'd never heard of this place, but definitely will come again when in the area.

Lots of available seating, both inside and outside. The inside had a nice ambiance - a good place to sit and work/read/chat with friends. The staff were really friendly. I tried their most common specialty chai: tiger spice chai. It was really good. Not super sweet and with a really distinct flavor of the chai spices. I tried a bit of my friend's drink, the elephant vanilla chai and it was also incredibly delicious. This one was more sweet and the spice flavors not as distinct -- definitely more along the vein of a "dessert" chai. Depending on your taste preference (sweet or more spice flavorful), there's a variety of speciality chais to explore. Would recommend!
author: Lucine O.

description: This is one of my favorite spots to warm up on Market street. Typically Chai is so sweet for me, but they offer so many different levels of spice that there's one that tickles everyone's fancy! And not to mention the variety of milks they offer - even Oat! I'm in looooove with da Chai Bar.
author: Tamara P.

description:
I really like this concept, very unique and first of its kind for chai/teas. We are all very familiar with the philz and peets of the world, so same concept but for chai lovers. 

The ambience is very nice and for a work meeting or catching up with a friend. You have the bar stools or the comfy chairs as well. 

Chai's here are pretty decent, I thought it was a little on the sweeter side and not as strong a tea flavor as I'm used to. I had the Orca Spice Sugar-Free Chai and  my friend had the Elephant Vanilla Chai. Both great drinks, only feedback is I hoped there was an option to have it a little strong chai flavor.
author: Darshana S.

description: If you're a fan of chai at all you must give this spot a try. The tiger chai (a house favorite) is literally one of the most delicious beverages you will ever have the pleasure to try. I get mine with soy milk-and it's still the creamiest & frothiest treat!! It's delicious both iced and warm.
author: Alia T.

description: This is my favorite chai ever. I used to get a chai latte at another place in San Francisco and finally asked how they made it and they told me they used David Rio Chai. Now today my dreams have come true and I'm trying all the chais. My favorite is still the Tiger Spice Chai. Definitely recommend if you are a chai head like me. ;)
author: Alison N.

description:
CHAI BAR
drink: elephant vanilla chai (sugar free & decaf) w/ boba

tasted somewhat like horchata and had a perfect mix of sweet, spice and creaminess. boba was mediocre but didnt subtract from drink. nevertheless i would say its one of my favorite boba teas ive tried

flavor: 5/5
freshness: 5/5
boba texture: 3/5
total: 13/15
author: Boba R.

description: This place makes my work day that much more bearable - it's centrally located and is a really big space with plenty of room for eating/studying/working/drinking chai tea!! My favorites have been the Tortoise Green Chai and the Tiger Spiced Chai w/ almond milk - such a perfect mid afternoon excuse to take a walk outside. Such an awesome spot, and very well made drinks!
author: Marites S.

description:
I got an iced elephant vanilla chai with macadamia milk.. let me just say OMG!! I didn't want to drink it because I didn't want to run out lol it was sooooo good. Good flavor, good texture, and so refreshing! I thought it was quite pricey, but worth it. It's what you'd expect to pay at a place close to downtown. The setup was also nice, staff were super nice, and it had a chill atmosphere. There are plenty of tables to sit and do work 

Side note, three of my friends got random drinks. They were all delicious. No complaints. This place is a must if you like chai. You won't be disappointed.

Also, thanks for the different non-dairy options! Y'all the real mvps!!
author: Tatiana P.

description:
Easy to find, not too expensive but you can enjoy so fine chai latte and pastries. Of course general drinks in cafe also available. Great place to be relaxing while either traveling, working or chatting!
I ordered tiger spice chai latte and a pastry. Total $8 is pretty good deal in down town and everyone in counter is so friendly!
author: 玲奈

description: This chai is delicious! I don't know where to start. They have multiple flavors of chai ranging from citrus to vanilla. In between are the spices and milk combinations (sugarfree, macadamia milk, almond milk, hazelnut milk, whole and 2%.) I purchased the flight which proved to be a great idea. Their PB cookie was delightful as well. Trendy and cute spot, so glad we stopped in!
author: Cassandra W.

description:
Love this place in such a busy city it has a great vibe and the service is excellent
The coffee and chai experience is great..
author: Anthony R.

description: So great to see a place dedicated to Chai with many offerings!  While the neighborhood is a bit economically up and coming, the staff is super nice.  It's also a bit pricey at 4.50 for a small.  But your also paying for a comfortable place to hang out which is needed in the area. Taste was good- mine was not overly sweet and could really taste the ginger which I loved!
author: Robert C.

description:
Chill place to study with some talking and chill background music, and others doing some work. The person at the cash register is really friendly! 

If you're planning to stay a bit, know there there's wifi and it can get a slight bit chilly. There's also wifi, although a bit slow - so if you're dependent on the network, I wouldn't recommend coming here to work. 

I got the brew of the day, large, and it's brewed well, not too acidic, very smooth. 

My friend got the tiger chai with soy milk - upon first sip, omg, the froth was amazing!! I'm also not a fan of chai, but I thought it was a good balance of spiciness, millkiness, and sweetness. My friend doesn't like her drinks too sweet, so she thought it was a bit too sweet, just a tad.
author: Jacqueline T.

description:
DO YOURSELF A FAVOR AND HEAD OVER HERE ASAP AND GET A TURMERIC LATTE! 
Have it iced or hot, either way the drink is out of this world. Add a little twist and ask for Tiger Spice with Turmeric in it and get the best of both worlds. Health and flavor. They have delicious breakfast sandwiches as well as rice bowls. I've tried their Tuna Sandwich which is also phenomenal! The overall atmosphere is homey and super chill, the baristas are dope. Say hi to them all, shout out to Mel and Ben for being amazing! SF is winning with Chai Bar as an addition to their chai community.
author: Ankita C.

description: Tried David Rio Chia Flight of Tiger Spice, White Shark, Cub, and Boldly Spice comes with Golden Butter and Wheat Cracker. My fav is Boldly Spice with cayenne, yum
author: Aloha M.

description: Great selection of chai teas and yummy scone samples. I like their couches. It was a relaxing place to drink chai and read books for an afternoon.
author: Aleksandra T.

description:
I think really highly of Lowe and Miura, the people behind Chai Bar, whose idea of protecting endangered species and shedding light on animal welfare should be applauded. A percentage (?) of profits from sales go to the International Fund for Animal Welfare for their global initiatives. 

The shop is spacious, clean, modern, and quite creative, with animal heads created from what looks like mesh that are mounted on the walls. Plenty of people use the space for productive purposes.

I had the signature Tiger Spice Chai, which was very sweet despite it supposedly having a balance between its sweet and spicy levels. I've had Chai brewed fresh with tea leaves, cardamom, anise, fennel, and cloves with a splash of milk and sugar, and the Tiger Spice Chai seemed quite a departure from that. Unfortunately you cannot customize the sweetness of drinks as everything is made from powder. What you can customize is the type of milk you use (soy, almond, etc). I suppose the purpose of having several Chai teas on the menu is for patrons to choose their sweet and spicy level, but the earthiness of the spices don't come out quite the way they would if you freshly brewed them. I may give the Cub Chai a go if I'm in the area as the sweetness should hopefully be turned down.
author: Cici T.

description: Chai Bar is the definition of hipster.  I love the decor here, and this place can get really crowded on a weekday.   I came here to grab a quick drink before going to my broadway show.   I got the Flamingo Vanilla decaf chai.  I didn't think much of it until my first sip.  And after that i was sold!  I loved how it was sweet but not too sweet but the chai gave it a perfect kick.   Even though the place gets crowded, the lines do move really fast.   They do have a good amount of seating here as long as you don't mind sharing a table.  I'll be back here with my friends if we need a place to just chill and relax.
author: Belinda C.

description: The best chai latte in town. I always get the Tiger Chai before a show at the SHN theater. I highly recommend this spot for the amazing lattes and the atmosphere.
author: Brittany B.

description:
The menu is to your left as you enter Chai Bar (do not look up or to your right).  I was a bit overwhelmed, but I really dug the variety.  We got an Elephant vanilla chai and tortoise chai.  Since the drinks taste rich and creamy even with fat free milk, I recommend starting off with skim.  Wish I had splurged on a macadamia milk option -- next time!       

Chai Bar is a much needed alternative to the millions of coffee shops in SF.  It's in a transitioning neighborhood; across the street is where Showdogs used to be.
author: Miran C.

description: Huge tea spot. They have coffee and food items also. Also have gram & go items and they sell their items in the shop. Had the vegan boba tea. Little pricey, but staff is nice & place is clean and huge, lots of seating
author: Taylor T.

description:
Safe and tasty zone to take refuge from the Zombie Apocalyptic streets of San Francisco! Clean, cute and good chai!

Is San Francisco trying to be the next Hollywood set? ‍‍‍
author: Jules M.

description:
Typing this while sitting in the Chai Bar watching the typical Market street scene of ambulances and police cars lined up along the sidewalk. Ah, San Francisco. 
 
I always walk past this place and am drawn by the orange coloring and cool interior, but this time I actually stepped inside and ordered a Green Tortoise Chai with almond milk. I was a bit afraid of not liking the chai or being overpowered by the milk when I saw how much the the barista was pouring into the cup, but I actually really liked it. The almond milk makes the drink so much more fragrant, and there was the slightest hint of spices from the chai. I didn't really catch the green tea flavor, but I'm okay with this too. 

There are a lot of places to sit inside and wifi. The bar facing the window is a bit low if you're planning on using a laptop and will most likely give you some back pain. There are couches and other tables throughout, and a variety of baked goods, sandwiches, and salads in case you need some food to go with your chai. I'm not a coffee person, so this is the perfect place for me to go if I want to do some work outside of the house and get a drink at the same time!
author: Sophie W.

description:
Capital Y-U-M. 

I didn't get to try a flight, but I did try their Elephant Chai, Iced. The interior is super cute and modern, with a natural vibe. There's some food items you can purchase, like sandwiches, onigiri (interesting) and other bottled beverages. After you order, there is plenty of seating both at the 
 bar, in front of what looks like an espresso machine, as well as various tables.

The chai (as well as my boyfriends that I tasted) was very rich and milky, which is exactly how I like it! 

I would definitely be back. Such a cute place to stop for a drink.
author: Rachel W.

description: Not the biggest chai fan but I decided to try their power chai and it was really good. Very spacious with lots of seats. Also clean bathrooms.
author: Sofia H.

description: Had a cold brew coffee and a chocolate chunk walnut muffin. Both were amazing. I'm not much of a tea drinker. So if you're like me, don't pass this place up thinking it only teas. They offer numerous pastries, coffees and food.  In fact, I'll be dreaming about that muffin for a long time. It was the best chocolate muffin I've ever had.
author: Loree L.

description: I use to come here a lot, but slowed down due to a rude cashier. I'm back because I like the owner. He is really nice and personable. Sometimes some of his staff is less than friendly, but hey.
author: Ro B.

description:
I've been coming to this classy little spot for a few weeks now, and it's been a real game changer for me. This place is everything a small business coffee shop cold hope to be. They have original drinks, food, special days, and great atmosphere considering the location. 

Front and center Market Street, closer to the Civic center side, can look a bit rough on the outside. The Chai Bar offers a chic little spot with plenty of outlets and modern charm. The staff is very friendly and keeps the place in good shape all throughout the day. They offer more than just chai, but it is definitely the primary draw. I can come in on any day, order a drink, and just work on random things between shifts. I once even spent a few hours here.

The food is good as well ! On Thursdays they hand make onigiri and it's totally worth it. At 3.75 a pop, they are filling and fresh. They offer their drinks both hot and cold, and the Golden Tumeric Latte is a great boost ( if you've ever been curious about trying the newest health craze, try it here ! ). They also offer beer and wine on tap, in case you want to get a little day drunk.

They change their WiFi every day, which is actually a solid idea, and they have a key code on their restroom. All in all, a solid business with a pretty big following already. Every day I see a bunch of folks on their computers or in small groups. It is a great gathering spot and I'll continue to visit here often.
author: Christine H.

description:
Beautiful decor and yummy chai. 

Considering the number of times I've walked by and said "I need to check out this place", you'd think I'd been here sooner. So when I got to pick a spot to co-work with, this was on the list. I came on a Wednesday morning and was surprised by how much seating there was. Seating and outlets throughout the side of the cafe made it a great place to work out of. Bathrooms were clean and there wasn't booming loud music or dim lighting that distracted us. The employees also didn't seem to care that we set up shop there. The free wifi worked great.

I ordered an Iced Dirty Tiger Spice Chai and it was delicious! It hit the spot during the heatwave and thinking about it makes me want to go back already.
author: Michelle C.

description: I like Chai Bar because 1) they're teas are great, and 2) they have comfy seating. I wish they stayed open longer during the evening.
author: Majid A.

description:
Chai Bar has the best chai tea lattes (though as a disclaimer, I haven't been to many other chai tea places).

My go-to is their signature Tiger Spice Chai. It's more on the sweet side than the spicy side. I've gotten it both hot and cold and would definitely recommend a hot one over the iced one.

Like that they have a dairy and non-dairy milk options.

They have a decent amount of indoor seating and some outdoor seating as well which makes it a nice place to grab coffee with a friend in the morning. They're pretty quick with managing orders and getting drinks out, even when there's a line.

They offer WiFi. I have yet to use it since it's password protected, but I'm sure you can ask the kind baristas for the code.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Oh my chai! I've been trying to find chai that reminds me of my fave coffee shop in my hometown and this place is it. Forget about Peets, Starbucks, Philz, and other coffee shop chais and come here. It was my first time here so I had to get the Tiger Chai (small/hot for $4.5) and it was delicious. Didn't taste watered down at all and in my opinion had the perfect balance of milk/cinnamon/sweetness. 

LOCATION: The place itself is well located near Powell bart/muni stops on Market St. 

AMBIANCE: The place itself reminds me of a lounge. There's tons of seating outside, window seating, but I love how they have booth style seats lining the place/tables. Big windows with plenty of natural light to bright up your day or just big enough to people watch people. 

Didn't stay here to work but seems like a place people frequent to do some work/catch up. 

*If you need to go to the restroom you need a code to access them in the back

Will need to come back to try an iced chai for sure.
author: Keizzel C.

description: Ambiance is great. Great place to do some computer work, meetings, or a date. Love the chai menu and now I need them all. There are small food offerings such as spam musubi and onigiri. I tried the spam musubi for simplicity and it was super tasty with a good spam to rice ratio. If you eat a lot they offer combo orders. Definitely coming back and recommending this place to friends!
author: Momo M.

description: I love the Elephant Vanilla Chai here as I have a weak spot for both vanilla and Chai. I tend to favor dessert coffee drinks so this sweet treat with its blend of creamy vanilla and aromatic spices is the perfect answer to a long day. The drinks are made from powder which does leave a bit of yearning for freshly brewed tea. The café itself is a pleasure to be in. It is open and spacious inside with pleasant décor. A great place to read or work or just chat. It's conveniently located on Market. I pass by it all the time when I'm downtown which is so tempting. It is also nice to know that they donate to animal welfare projects and organizations. Now that is something I can stand behind!
author: Lauren H.

description:
Chai Bar by David Rio has a very interesting interior concept. I love it. Very artsy. and utilizes a very open space concept with communal seating. Located on Market Street, I definitely would drop by the next time I'm in San Francisco. It's such a nice place to watch the world pass me by as I sit to sip darkness into my soul. --next time I should try the chai tho.

The moment you walk into David Rio, there is a warming feel from the Chai spices. You know, the same way you walk into an abercrombie and fitch, but without a headache, but a sense of clarity in the world.

I had an americano because they ran out of house coffee --$3.25. Not bad. But aside from the  atmosphere, I didn't think the coffee was spectacular. The cups are very eco friendly. The lid was very thin and gave me the feeling that it wasn't going to hold up as I drank from it. You know...because it's bio degradable---you just aren't sure if.....it was going to hold up, because it's already....degrading?
author: Thomas K.

description:
I LOVE CHAI. If I were tea, I think I would be chai. Brown. Sweet. Spicy. But just sweet enough to bring out the spice. Versatile. Whitewashed at times (lookin at you, Starbucks pumpkin spice chai tea latte). Bold. But bitter when not in its right state. Yeah idk where I'm going with this but I love chai hahaha

I was walking down the street when the words "CHAI BAR" immediately caught my attention. I forgot why I was even in the city and immediately rushed in. The orange cups and hipster aesthetic were calling my name. DAS MY JAM

The first time I was here, there was a fly in my drink :( I went back and told the baristas, and they gave me a refund. I was super disgusted and irked that there was a huge winged insect floating around in my tea, but I was kinda bummed that they didn't also offer to remake it...idk I was really enjoying it before I noticed the fly (and then proceeded to do a spit-take). But I needed a place to study and thought of David Rio and decided to give it a second chance recently!!

What I've had:
- Elephant White Chai, iced with macadamia milk:  This has Madagascar vanilla and honey. It was REALLLLLLY sweet. I kinda thought it was way tooooooo sweet...but I still really liked it? I almost never get my tea with sweetener, so the first sip was like...wow this is not what my mouth was expecting. They rank all of their drinks using a flavor guide bar for sweet and spicy, and this one was more towards the sweet end. But I was really intrigued by the description of the combo of vanilla and honey. Overall, super delicious and refreshing!! But maybe not the best choice if you like your drinks without sweetener
- Tiger Spice Chai, iced with macadamia milk: This is their signature blend. It has ground cinnamon, cardamom, and clove. This is supposed to be around half sweet and half spicy, but I kinda thought this was way too sweet too...nonetheless, super refreshing and full of flavor. I could definitely taste the hint of spiciness, even if it was kinda overpowered. Maybe it was the macadamia milk adding to the sweetness too? Idk...but I really liked the nutty taste of it! It's not something you can find everywhere. I highly recommend this brew!!

Bottom line: I think I'll be back if I'm in the area!! I kinda wanna try the Boldly Spiced Chai straight up (unsweetened + cayenne pepper). Cayenne in tea...interesting. ALSO THEY HAVE MACADAMIA MILK!! That's kinda rare!! It costs an additional $1.00. As for their other non-dairy milk options, they have soy, almond, and hazelnut (pretty rare for a tea/coffee place), which all cost $0.50. I believe iced drinks only come in the large size. They have wifi and power outlets, as well as a bunch of seating. The wifi wasn't the fastest, but it worked. They also serve coffee, alcohol, and food. Kinda pricy...but worth checking out!
author: Kithumini J.

description: I like this place. The chai tea is pretty good. The food hits the spot. Always clean and friendly.
author: Scot M.

description: I. Love. This. Place. The baristas are awesome, the food options are healthy and most importantly it's clean. David, the manager, always welcomes feedback and has great ideas for their food menu. Outside seating gives you front and center people watching on Market Street. Ample seating inside with free wi-fi. Why go anywhere else?
author: Catherine A.

description:
Nice clean coffee place. Good WiFi strength, good for hanging out and taking a break with the family. 

Re: their star product - Their spiciest chai is ok, but real chai isn't made as a latte. Seems like they've taken the "chai tea latte" from Starbucks and attempted it into a franchise. 

Tourists will eat it up, and real chai drinkers and makers won't come back. 

Good branding.
author: Liz F.

description:
I was drawn into Chai Bar because of the sushi-bowl-sign, apparently they have different options each day starting at 11AM. I did not get a bowl, it's popular so get there sooner than later.

I ordered their Cub Chai with macadamia nut milk. I had no idea they made this type ofmilk, what a surprise! Stop grab a hot drink, if you did not score a bowl get a bite to eat from their grab & go refrigerator which offers some gluten free options, or stay and do some work. 

As for their Chai- creamy, smooth & fulfilling. The macadamia milk gave it just the flavor I was craving for.
author: Benji P.

description:
Very cool space. Super spacious and delicious chai menu with your usual cafe options for coffee as well .  Limited food options to cookies and baked goods in the case. 
Lots of tables, and standing space.  It was mid day when we got there, and there was no line and not that many people inside, and while we ordered like 5 drinks - the drinks took awhile to come out. I'll have to go back to see if they always take a long time or if it was just that one time. I wouldn't recommend it if you were in a rush.
author: Veronica L.

description:
I like the concept, but I don't feel like the taste of the chai is very authentic and I am not a huge fan of how sweet the drinks are. Also, a small chai comes out to about $4.50 so Chai Bar is not a place I frequent. 

[Chai]
I've tried the Elephant Vanilla with Breve and the Tiger. I liked the Elephant Vanilla a bit more, but I was not blown away by the taste of the drinks. However, it did taste better than Pete's chai latte (ew). 
 
[Service]
Servers are really friendly...but for some reason, the credit card machine here has a hard time reading my card and I've definitely had to try a couple cards on occasion. Be warned that if you come in the morning, there can be a longer wait time. It's definitely taken like ~10 minutes for me to get a drink here. 

Would give it a one-time try, but wouldn't come back too often.
author: Alice Z.

description:
Was walking down this stretch of Market checking out the Prototyping Festival yesterday and yelped (pun intended) to my partner, "Look! A new coffee/tea place! Can we check it out so I can yelp it?" 

Obvi Chai Bar is only new *to me* given the over 200 reviews but I guess I don't frequent this section of Market often except for morning runs. 

Chai Bar joins the aggressive growth of new businesses in the mid-Market area like Popson's, Equator, Showdogs, the Hall, etc. etc. 

Let's start with what Chai Bar does right:
Great space- if I worked outside of my office, I would laptop-up to one of their tables and work for hours. Open, airy, cozy, comfortable space to meet a friend for a tea or work for the afternoon. Their staff is refreshingly diverse and they created a place with arguably one of my favorite cold-weather drinks: Chai.

BUT I have to say that my Tiger Chai (their signature chai, spicy and sweet) just wasn't that good :/ It was also $4.50 for a small! It's tea and milk! Hooooowwww?!? Also, having two sizes and calling one
"Medium" and the other "Large" is not slick at all. I know I'm still paying basically $5 ($6 with tip) for some tea.

Can't say I'll be back given the cost and closer options to my apartment with delicious pastries **and** excellent coffee/tea.
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Oh wow, this is a chai heaven! There are about seven options for chai; each has a bar indicator for the spicy/sweet combination. 

I had a meeting here today, and this place has ample seating, quick, friendly service, and tasty chai options. I am also glad to see nice places expanding and taking over the Civic Center messy neighborhood.
author: Anelya S.

description: Love this place!! The chai is out of this world (and supports a great cause) and the employees are just lovely! Megan and Lucas were especially helpful and so friendly. They went out of their way with excellent customer service, which is very much appreciated. This is a business I'm happy to support!
author: Molly B.

description:
Finally went!!

Drinks = awesome. 

Friend tried White Shark (white tea, citrus & black pepper) with hazelnut non-dairy option, and dirty (add espresso).  She loved it and I liked the sip I had, too! $4.50 plus $0.50 for dirty add-on. 

He tried Tiger (ground cinnamon, cardamom & clove) with macadamia non-dairy option. He liked it. While I thought it was too sweet for me. $5.50.

We also ordered an extra Tiger with whole milk for a friend. $4.50. 

I tried Cub (fresh pressed ginger, cardamon & black pepper) with 2% milk.  The Cub was more spicy than sweet.  And I loved it.  I asked the cashier and she made a great recommendation. $4.50.

Overall, I'm impressed with the selection of chai. Yes, I agree, there appears to be some amount of sugar in your drink--whether it's the tea or milk/nut milk. 

Seating = looks like a nice space but we had to get going.  Maybe next time. 

Service = friendly.  My only complaint was with our 4 drinks, none of them were marked (not on the lid, on the side, etc.) And I didn't see a pen/marker anywhere either.  

Prices = moderate. $4.50 for medium, $5.50 for large.
author: Fannie S.

description:
I'm torn.  I will be the first to admit that I'm a chai addict.  The fact that Chai Bar offers a "cub chai" with ginger and endless options for customization certainly appeals to my addiction, and I was definitely not disappointed by my order.  I would definitely pay the higher price for a chai of the quality I received.

But then a mouse ran by my feet within 5 minutes of me sitting down at the back of the shop to work on my laptop.  I sh*t you not.  It's not that I have any illusions about the cleanliness of ground-floor establishments in a large city- I'm sure that I've been in plenty of rodent-infested restaurants and coffee shops in my life- but to see a mouse scurry across the floor an inch from your feet during your first visit to a shop kinds of shoots down your initial impressions of a place...
author: Sophia G.

description: The staff was extra friendly, the place was very clean and had a nice feel. We enjoyed trying a couple of their unique chai teas and look forward to stopping in again on our next trip to the city.
author: Sandra B.

description:
Such a lovely spot! 

I've passed by Chai Bar several times and had the chance to stop by a few times in the past week. The first to pick up a coffee for my boyfriend and the second to pick up some chai and a pastry for myself. 

First and second time walking in...I don't know! I just like it! Clean and chill place with plenty of seating and tables for catching up with friends or with your work. Both times, the staff were friendly, sweet, and great to chat with. 

The first time, I just wanted to pick up some kind of caffeine pick-me-up for my boyfriend so I walked in and ordered a Dirty Chai (with Original Tiger Spice) for him and a Power Chai for myself. Both were flavorful and creamy though mine was more flavorful and his was more sweet. 

Second time, I wanted to pick up something small before heading to work so I grabbed a Tortoise Green Tea Chai and a butter croissant. I liked this drink more than the first one I had because it seemed even creamier and had a mellow sweetness and mild spiciness. I don't think they make the pastries in house, but I liked my croissant enough. Not incredibly flaky which is great for minimal mess!

Overall, very impressed by Chai Bar by David Rio! Consistent quality in so many ways. Their chai lattes are soooo creamy even when I use almond milk! I plan to use macadamia milk next time just to try it!
author: Sofia R.

description:
I have tried their mixes before I found it there is a bar in San Francisco. So delicious and even better fresh! I plan to stop by to try some of their other drinks! So far, I've only tried the cub chai with soy, which was amazing! Next time I'd like to try one of the chai lattes with the macadamia milk.

I've tried the tiger spice and elephant vanilla from their powder mixes. Both are awesome! I think it's better when made with milk (or milk substitute - like almond milk!) Still delicious when made with water.
author: Liz M.

description:
This place is consistent with the quality of their beverages. The price is a little high with large drinks being closer to $6.00 with tax. I don't know that I would call their drinks chai as most are mainly sugar and milk. It's fine with me, but others may not like. 

I have tried their pork belly rice bowl, which was okay, but was a bit over priced for what was in it. The egg was a bit overdone and dry. I won't be trying this again. 

The breakfast sandwiches are okay for the price, but lack seasoning. 

The pastry selection is good. The bacon cheddar scone was a little underwhelming in flavor as neither flavor really popped for me. The cheese danish was tougher than I expected it to be and the cheese part lacking, but still delicious. I wish the fruit parfait was less pricey as with tax it is over $5.00 and sometimes a bit watery where the fruit sits. 

I will probably continue to visit this place every now and then given how close it is to my work.
author: Ashley M.

description: I've been here a couple times, and I'd come here again when I'm in the mood for chai. The chai here is great and it's also a nice place to just hang out and chat. There is quite a bit of seating, and the ambience is pretty chill.
author: Livvie L.

description:
I didn't realize that there were so many different types of chai tea. I had the regular tiger spice chai with almond milk and (accidentally) gulped it down in a few minutes. It was sweeter than I expected and lightly spiced, not as creamy as the macadamia nut milk that I had a sip of. Both were really good. 

Super friendly and knowledgeable cashiers. Loved the vibe and comfy chairs here. There is wifi and hidden outlines under the seat cushions!
author: Juliana P.

description: I stumbled upon this gem today and I knew I was in for a treat. Never before had I ever thought that I would become a fan of chai tea let alone finding a cafe that specializes in it. But like what they always say--never say never. Chai Bar pretty much made me eat my doubts today. Out of the handful of their delectable chai tea selections, I decided to go with the Elephant vanilla chai. Let me just say that  I was not in the least bit disappointed by that selection. In fact, I dare say that it was probably the best decision I've made all day. My latte tasted perfectly sweet and creamy with a hint of vanilla and cinnamon with each sip. I just couldn't get enough of it. And what's best to enjoy with the awesome chai in my hand is the nice and comfy ambience of the place. Chai bar is pretty balanced in its setting in that it's spacious and cozy all at the same time. With the huge tables, you can get your geek gears out to get your productivity on. But at the same time, you can also just sit back and relax on the nice pillow cushions that are provided on the seats. If I'm ever in this area again, I'd be excited to try their other chai tea selections.
author: Joy H.

description:
I've come here hundreds of times when I had Zendesk (the company upstairs) as a client, whether for a cup in the morning to get my energy going before work, a chai run for my team, or an afternoon pick-me-up when I was falling asleep!

MY GO TO DRINK - Elephant Vanilla Chai with macadamia milk, LARGE! If you have a sweet tooth, this drink is a godsend. If I didn't order my usual (which was rare), I'd get either their classic Tiger Spice or their Tortoise Green Tea. If you have a stronger taste for spice, one of my colleagues would frequent the Cub Chai (which is also vegan!) She'd also order the Power Chai and White Shark once in a while. The staff is always so friendly as well, I enjoyed the small conversations I'd have with them while waiting for my order. I even got on a first-name basis with some of them (what can I say- I'm a regular!)

I no longer work in SF, yet still I regularly order heaps of the Elephant Vanilla Chai on Amazon! I have a canister available in my cubicle drawer so I still drink it every day. If that doesn't say enough about how much I love their chai, I don't know what will.
author: Rachel B.

description:
Chair Bar was our default because everything was closed on a Sunday afternoon. It was also raining, so our location was limited. The Chai Lattes were all made from powder, so you can't really adjust the sweetness. I don't usually mind that for Chai, but I was expecting something more homemade as they specialize in Chai tea, not Starbucks where you'd expect the Chai latte to be made from packaged products.

The ambiance was also strange. There's actual beer on tap on one side of the counter, and there are also some couches for seating on one side of the room. All the comfy seating was taken so we settled for bar seating, but it just didn't seem like the space made sense. Is it a coffee/tea place or is it a bar where you drink beer and watch games? They're trying to make  drinking beer a coffee/tea thing, and I'm not getting it.
author: Debbie O.

description:
This place has delicious chai but their chai is sometimes too milked down. I always ask for more chai and less milk. That makes a big difference. 

I do wish this place would open earlier. Opening at 11am on a Saturday morning is not ideal. Especially since I'd like my cup of coffee or chai tea around 8am.
author: E C.

description: Best chai tea in San Francisco hands down. I consider myself a chai connoisseur, and have been searching high and low for the best chai tea in SF, since moving here from New York 5 years ago. My spot in NYC was mudd cafe and I was heart broken that is never find a suitable replacement here. So happy I stumbled upon David Rio chai bar on my way to work. This place rocks my chai loving world.
author: Joey B.

description:
Not the best location but my company's office is located a block away so I tried this place out an early friday morning.

Had the Dirty Chai Latte ....which is 2 shots of espresso added to your choice of chai (which choosing a chai isn't easy here because they all sound delish). I went with the tiger spice chai and......could this be the BEST bfast beverage EVER?? Maybe...but def the best that I have had this year. Give it a try
author: Jimmy A.

description:
I'm a chai fanatic who never orders coffee at a cafe. I've been here about 5 times and I always get the same thing:  Vanilla Elephant Chai with Macadamia nut milk. Price is around $4-5. If you like your chai non-spicy and sweet, try this combo. 

This place rarely gets too crowded, which is unusual in downtown SF cafes. I like the vibe of this place. Clean and simple. A great place to work if you're looking for a chill atmosphere. Employees are always very sweet.
author: Christine C.

description:
OhmygodOhmygodOhmygod how I loooovvee Chai Bar!!
Their drinks can be a bit on the expensive side but it's a price I gladly pay again and again (and again) I'm in love with the Tiger Chai  but all their drinks are great and I love how you can customize them. If you don't know what to order, or want to try something new the workers are always happy to assist or make recommendations. Everyone I've run across has had a positive attitude and I love the space inside. Very chill vibe, clean and bright. Great seating for catching up with friends, large tabletops for when you need to get some work done. All around great hang out spot.
author: Heather L.

description:
I wasn't intending on stopping by this place but I'm a huge fan of Chai tea and this place seemed so inviting.

The barista/server was great at being friendly, providing small talk, and recommending the Tiger Spice Chai, which I had with almond milk. It was so exceptionally creamy and delicious! I'm glad I took his recommendation.

There's lots of seating, it's pretty quiet, I'm not sure if they offer wifi but it's certainly good for reading and chilling before heading to your next destination.

Update: they offer wifi!
author: Megan R.

description: Absolutely love this place and the staff are incredible and very friendly! The ambiance is most definitely warm and inviting; the food and beverages here are just great but slightly expensive. I love and recommend their tea frost frappé (Earl Grey + almond milk) but will try some of the other items on their menu!
author: Shaniah M.

description:
I've been here about 4 times or so and each time I get the same thing, the Tiger Spice Chai. And each time, it's like discovering it for the first time. It's seriously just plain satisfying.

In summary, I don't often drink chai teas, but when I do, I go to Chai Bar.
author: Gonzalo S.

description: Drove all the way here just to buy me a container of the elephant vanilla chai because I'm HOOKED. Super DELICIOUS I've become a chai addict. The vibe inside is super chill & the staff is very friendly especially Ben had a nice time talking to him.
author: Karla A.

description: Oh my goodness WOW! I discovered David Rio Chai tea at a tea shop in Leavenworth about 5 years ago. When I saw the sign today I knew I needed a cup! In the chai bar the tea was even more amazing! We grabbed breakfast sandwiches with our chais and had an amazing breakfast. I loved the elephant white chai and the market sandwich! Favorable amount of bacon to cheese ratio on a super soft bun!
author: Kristina K.

description:
After receiving a thoughtful message from the business recommending the "Cub Chai" I have decided to update my review.

I'm still not a fan but the "Cub Chai" was better than my previous experience. If you're looking for a dessert-like beverage or a spicy wake up call you may find something to your liking at the Chai Bar. And although I went for 2% milk, they have a multiple non-dairy option which is always a plus.
author: Kartik S.

description: Maybe not the most authentic Chai, but very delicious with tons of unique options and convenient location. I got the elephant vanilla with hazelnut milk (first time trying or even seeing that)-divine. My friend kept on stealing sips from me. Fun place to hang after work or school.
author: Crystal Y.

description: I've now been to the Chai Bar a half dozen times and brought friends to try it too. The cub chai is officially my favorite, a bit of foam and a good amount of spice! The place itself is cozy. Some of the two seat wooden tables are long so if you go there to study with a friend, you both will have ample room to spread everything out. The baristas and employees are some of the friendliest people I've met. This is my new favorite hang out whenever I'm in the city. Sorry SF downtown Starbucks, the Chai Bar has me every time I'm there.
author: Olivia C.

description:
Wow...nice!

That's the first impression I got when I walked in yesterday.

I had just dropped off my baby for her oil change/checkup at Automotive Technicians, about 3 blocks away.  Even though I had my man & his car w me, we decided to walk over to check this place out before driving off into the world.  

Walking from Turk between Jones & Leavenworth to Market between Jones & Taylor streets?!  This is the tenderloin!  I only agreed cuz the man was w me, & it's too close to call for an Uber (allegedly).  Plus, we had a getaway car waiting for us back at Auto Tech...

It was quite a walk.
One I won't soon forget.
Nothing like a strong stench of urine to fragrance your morning walk to tea, right?
That whole "we're cleaning up the tenderloin" thing?
So far it's not happening...

So imagine how happy I was to be welcomed by a sweet barista, a large chic & cool space, & house made treats.

The barista was a rockstar.  Informative & personable.
They have hazelnut & macadamia milk?!
They bake all their pastries right here?!

The chocolate chip walnut scone was fantastic.  Crisp, lots of walnuts, good chocolate.  I loved it.

I went w a matcha latte w macadamia milk.  It's not sweetened, so if that's what you're used to it might be a bit off-putting.  The matcha is high quality.  It was just what I needed.

They have all the espresso drinks in addition to chai, for all the espresso die hards out there.

Very cool artwork representing the city adorning the walls.

We were even thanked for coming in w a big smile after we walked out.

This place is a huge treat, especially for this area.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Chai Bar is a nice modern tea and light bites cafe in Mid Market and a welcome addition to my lunch rotation. I've been for happy hour from 3-6 PM with $5 beers and for lunch. Very friendly service and there's even a greeter who will suggest different teas. I had the Boldly Spiced Chai with whole milk which was "very spicy" and a good balance between both warm, slightly creamy, yet refreshing.

They also sell prepacked salads, sandwiches and onigiri which are made on site and fresh. The seaweed salad is a great snack, chewy and crunchy with lots of bite in the way seaweed is and just enough to hold you over. I also had their seasonal medley salad which consisted of a hard boiled egg, goat cheese, beets and some seasonal fruits and spicy chai vinaigrette. Haven't had them yet but the pastries are baked fresh. It's possible to get a filling, high quality, quick grab and go bite for lunch under $10 which is impressive by SF standards. There's also 10% discount if you work or live in the neighborhood. Spacious interior with lots of windows and light where you can hang out and work and a few outdoor tables as well.
author: Truc N.

description:
This is my personal favorite place for a chai, but there are some things to note: 

Cons: 
1. The area in which Chai Bar is located is sketchy and I have had a couple bad experiences of being harassed by people when coming to or from Chai Bar 
2. The Chai is super sweet- I would recommend tasting a sample before you buy the drink as many of my friends feel that its too sweet

Pros: 
1. The variety of chais is amazing- from tumeric chai to sugar-free chai, the options are endless 
2. The environment is nice and a great place to get work done 

I believe the chais here are better than at Samovar.
author: Claudia L.

description: Finally had a chance to check this place out and it did not disappoint. Got the Elephant Chai latte which is on the sweeter side and it was perfectly creamy and smooth. Dare I say it -- this the best chai I ever had. They have a couple different flavors that vary in spiciness. Decor feels sleek yet vintage. Lots of sitting space. $4.50 for their smallest size.
author: Wendy L.

description:
Upgrading my review to 5 stars because of all-star customer service!

I've been coming here since they opened in May 2015, and this place has become my regular meeting spot (I come 2- 3 times a month).

I always feel welcomed here. There's sometimes a friendly greeter at the door, and the staff is helpful. They truly want you to enjoy your drink, food, and overall experience. Luis (the GM) always takes time to interact with customers and ensure each one is satisfied.

They've expanded their menu- offering several creative chai drinks, beer, wine, tea, baked goods, and light lunch food. All tasty and made with care.

More people are finding out about this place, so it's getting busy!
author: Joanna L.

description:
Can not believe I didn't find out about David Rio Chai until I had one in Copenhagen a few months ago. Every coffee shop there carries this brand and they love their hot beverages in Scandinavia. Little did I know it's from San Francisco, where I live!

Had to come by on a chilly summer day and try it firsthand. This place is so great!

Loved the vanilla dirty chai but they have lots of different flavors to try as well as coffee, and wine/beer on tap. You can also buy products to go. 

They have my favorite caramel waffle cookie that I could not get enough of in Copenhagen but it goes really well with a hot chai. 

Enjoy!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Has chai actually become a "thing" now? Apparently so judging by the surprisingly expansive space opened by chai connoisseurs David Scott Lowe and Rio Miura, former spouses who continued as business partners. They see it as the intractable bridge between coffee and tea. I see it as a good excuse to reinvigorate an area adjacent to the problematic corner of Sixth Street and Market. Between this business, Equator Coffee across Market and Montesacro Pinseria on Stevenson, I have a guarded optimism about seeing something of a commercial lift in the neighborhood. I came by around 7PM on a Tuesday and noticed they were already starting to get ready to close by 8. At the same time, they didn't rush me along either.

In fact, there's a greeter who stands at the door and does a bit of a commercial about the place. He seemed too skinny to be a bouncer like the guy who constantly stands in front of the door at Equator. As I perused the eight choices of chai on the menu (photo: http://bit.ly/1RATZHj), I decided to try their signature drink, the $4.50, 12-ounce Elephant Vanilla Chai where they blend black tea with Madagascar vanilla. What I liked in particular was the big cup in which they serve it plus the pitcher where they place the overage amount (photo: http://bit.ly/1JjyFfL). I sat myself at the orange banquette at a large table since there were only three other customers in the place. It was smooth though maybe a tad sweeter than I was hoping it would be.

They sell tea and coffee in case you're not willing to jump on the chai bandwagon. They even offer an Arnold Palmer-like cold drink called the Steph Curry, of course. There are baked goods including pretzels and a caramel cookie waffle that looked intriguing (photo: http://bit.ly/1HQ8c8x), although nothing was appealing to me at that hour. Probably of most interest is a laboratory-like set-up in a room behind the counter where Lowe apparently comes up with new variations on chai. I noticed he's adding a bubble chai selection which made me think he could take advantage of customer spillover from Sharetea in the Metreon. I hope its hipster-centric following can keep Chai Bar by David Rio afloat for the foreseeable future.

CHAI - 4 stars...one big cup of sweetness but it's rich enough to keep my interest
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...nothing wrong with a lot of space, especially in this neighborhood
SERVICE - 3 stars...a bit terse and coolish
TOTAL - 4 stars...chai me up, chai me down
author: Ed U.

description: I had the turmeric chai and it was very tasty! The place is spacious and well-designed. Probably the best chai that I've had in SF.
author: Johnathan W.

description: I'm hooked with your Sugar free Chai  tea by coincidence I was at my local grocery store and purchased some green tea .i saw your chai tea individual serving  I bought a couple packs ,I prepared a cup of your Chai   Tea   my first taste  was so delicious I knew right there I had to find out more about your teas  love that they are  organic  no chemicals I am so pleased and I will  have to try your different flavors  thank you a new happy customer
author: Rebecca G.

description: Great place to sit and work for extended amounts of time. I got Paulie's Drink with soy - yum!
author: Lynn K.

description:
Two stars because it's nice in there, and the staff are friendly.

However, the chai is a premix, and too sweet. Pretty lame for a place called 'Chai bar'. Fresh made chai is hard to find in the U.S.
author: Jodie F.

description:
I used to walk by Chai Bar all the time before it opened, so I kept wondering what it was about, and now I've finally had the opportunity to experience it. I'm not the biggest fan of chai (and honestly not an expert on "good" chai) but I'm open to trying it every once in awhile. The barista was helpful in making recommendations and explaining the various menu options. 

Ultimately I decided on the Tiger Chai with macadamia milk. I couldn't resist macadamia milk since I just came back from Hawaii. It was delicious! Good change of pace from my usual afternoon coffee and a cool and spacious place to hang out. My boyfriend expressed his dislike of the ceiling and lighting design, which I found amusing. But overall this is a fun place to add variety to your exploration of SF coffeeshops. Would come here again!
author: Stefanie C.

description: Huge chai tea selection! I was shocked to see and taste how many countries have their own variation. David Rio has brought to life an educational flavor experience. I highly recommend this tea house to all pallets.
author: Maegin N.

description:
Amazing service! Super friendly and knowledgeable, as well as tasty drinks. The atmosphere is great and well put together. No free wifi, but great variety on their menu so that makes up for it in my opinion  I got the iced elephant vanilla chai with tapioca pearls and it was delicious! Definitely coming back here and recommending. Glad I heard about this place!!

Went back a second time a few weeks later and had excellent service, and one of the employees even remembered me! Definitely my new spot. Can't find one thing wrong with this place!!

Ps they DO have free wifi, just ask someone at the counter for the password :)
author: Cassandra K.

description:
I don't know who David Rio is, but he's a genius and I bet he doesn't even Chai. (Har har...)

I had several different samples here and found all of them to be quite tasty. However, I found my favorite to be the Cub chai because of how spicy it was. The elephant, tiger, and chocolate chai were all a bit sweet for my liking.

I got the Cub chai with almond milk and found that the almond milk gave it just enough sweetness to balance out the spiciness.

Four drinks from here totaled to just around $21, so definitely not cheap, but oh-so yummy! 

The workers were extremely friendly and there was plenty of seating inside to come and study or chat.
author: Annie C.

description:
OMG I am in love with this place - lots of great options for chai and super customizable to your taste buds.

I'm personally a fan of their elephant chai, which is on the sweeter side with a lot of vanilla influence. I always opt to make it dirty to cut the sweet a bit and the result is a pretty amazing drink.

They also have plenty of room for hanging out if you want to set up shop for awhile or have a great chat with a friend!
author: Elliott W.

description:
This spot is a gem. The chai is delicious, the folks behind the bar are friendly and kind: not bullshit-tip-me-nice, but genuine nice folks. Few weeks ago i caught up on work email here with a chai, last week had a meeting with 6 people here. Today i ducked in for a Fort Point IPA after a long workday. 
Great place.
author: Inez I.

description: Their concentrates are in tetra packs and brewed waaay to sweet for me. Total disappointment, too much money just to be served a boxed and reheated drink.
author: MaMa Spatula H.

description: The medium tiger spice chai ($4.50) helped warm me up on a cold day. Really enjoyed the vibe and would come back again
author: Wesley K.

description:
Love this place! I've never seen a bar/cafe like this before. This is why I love the Bay so much! We are creative and we come up with ideas that help being more flavor to the city.

A bar dedicated to French chai?! I'll take it. Their menu is extensive with lots of different chai mixed drinks to choose from. I ordered their famous Tiger Spice Chai which is black tea infused with cinnamon, cardamon, and cloves. I had my creamy chai with 2% milk. The chai was fluffy and creamy textured. For about $5 this was worth it. It comes in a fancy wide mug & artsy saucer. The baristas do a great job taking their time on the drinks and serving efficiently. 

I'm so glad I got to try this place out because now I'll be taking some people to enjoy too!
author: Allister D.

description: Was curious about this chai place when I walked by. So I went in and got their tiger spice. Best decision for today !
author: Bella D.

description:
Spacious tea shop with an interesting selection of tea (I had a lightly sweatened iced genmaicha), plenty of seats and table space. 

There's also wifi but it was a bit spotty... Overall it's a pretty decent place to drink some tea and do some work.
author: Lily L.

description:
Elephant vanilla chai is way too sweet.  Could hardly taste the chai because of the sweetness of the vanilla.  I'm sure everyone coming here is a chai lover/aficionado, so i would suggest getting something else to satisfy your craving.

Otherwise, the interior is pretty lovely.  Spacious and inviting.  I enjoyed sitting by the window just people-watching and killing some time.
author: Vanessa C.

description:
When two weeks pass and you still can't stop thinking about a place.. You know the love is real. You also know it's time to write a Yelp review. Honestly, Chai Bar, I'm sorry I didn't write this earlier because I really don't know how I lived my life without ever knowing you. 

Chai Bar is the light at the end of the tunnel, the unicorn in the middle of horses. You walk in and not only smell the brewing of chai, but feel its warmth and welcoming. Look up and to your left and you'll find the menu filled with options for any person walking in. Iced? Hot? To stay? To go? Spicy? Chocolate? You name it. The staff is chill and friendly and are happy to discuss all things chai.

Take a seat, get some wifi and jump into your work, or a good book. There are many seats available, cushions and chairs at various sized tables. Don't worry, there are a lot of outlets too. Just look down. The atmosphere is relaxing, accompanied by soothing music featuring artists like Ed Sheeran, Colbie Caillat and Norah Jones. The bathroom is in the back. Just ask.

You get a good amount for what you pay for, at least in my opinion. A large cup of your iced drink or a cup of warmth with a pot on the side containing the rest of your order. The quality is fantastic, and has me thinking about it 15 days later. You can even buy the chai in powder form in the store, or even on Amazon. Unfortunately, I didn't buy it in the store and completely regret it. I'll be buying some (a lot) on Amazon soon. Part of me really wants to go back to San Francisco, but only to sit in this cafe for hours on end, trying the different chai blends David Rio has to offer. I would live here if I could. You can quote me. There's not much else I can say except.. Go here. And bring me back some chai! Whether you like chai or not, it's a must try. I promise you you'll find something you like. :)
author: Kristi T.

description:
Came here today and picked up a vanilla chai which was way too sweet and wasn't hot enough (it was quite cold today and I was a little disappointed that my drink became lukewarm quickly).

I also tried their spam musubi which was surprisingly delicious. I was a little hesitant at first because it was in the fridge section which I thought would make the rice hard but it didn't. The flavor of soy was quite balanced and proportion of rice and spam was enough for a meal. 

My coworker had the dark chocolate walnut scone which she shared half with me because it was so big! I'm not normally a fan of scones but this one was pretty good. The texture was more of a crumbly cookie.

I definitely want to come back and try their other chais and I am excited for their bubble chai when they offer it!
author: Tiffany L.

description: Cool chai focused cafe along Market!  It is a nice cafe in the not so nice part of Market Street.  I would never consider coming here at night, but then again they close in the evening anyways!  The interior here is pretty big, with half the place looking like a cafe, and the other half with more of a bar feel.  They have a big variety of chai based drinks which I hadn't seen before at other SF cafes.  Their menu helped you pick out a drink that suited your tastes which I found very helpful.  The drinks here are pretty good and the service was very helpful.  If you're looking here to study or work, keep in mind that the internet is limited per purchase.
author: Bryson L.

description:
Really nice place if you need to study (free Wi-Fi!) and the chai here is delicious!

I tried the tortoise chai yesterday and I loved how the sweetness and spiciness were perfectly balanced. My friend ordered the elephant chai, but it was slightly too sweet and the vanilla was a little overwhelming for me. He still really enjoyed it, however. The point is, there's something here for everyone, so whether you enjoy spicy or sweet chais, you will find something you like here.

Definitely coming back during finals week when I need a light caffeine boost and somewhere nice to study.
author: Trisha V.

description:
Do you want chai that doesnt taste like chai? Do you like drinking cake batter? Do you value hispter culture? Then this crappy disgusting place is for you. The chai at naan n curry is better than the nasty cake batter flavored chai they serve.

Do you enjoy homeless crack heads by the door? Do you want to be served by white people with dreadlocks? Do you want to go to a place that never has a line? then this place is for you.
author: Dale L.

description:
I'll mimic the others commenting - Chai Bar is chai heaven. Personal favorite is the Elephant Vanilla with soy - and I like to get it "dirty" (shot of espresso). Tortoise is also good. Definitely pay attention to the spicy/sweet scale if you have a preference!

Nice place to sit and work, but wifi is done on a customer-by-customer basis for 1 hour per purchase. Slightly annoying, but makes sense.
author: Steffan P.

description: Came here on a rainy afternoon. There was a bit of a line but moved quickly. I got the Elephant Vanilla Chai with soy milk. The texture is thicker and creamier than I thought, with just the right amount of sweetness. It's a cozy cafe to stop by if you happen to pass by on Market st.
author: Michelle C.

description: This place is dummy good for chai. Ive usually get the dirty dirty dirty tiger spice chai and haven't been disappointed once. The vibe is DJ Khaled on point and the peeps are all nice in here plus they hook it up sometimes on the rewards card which I can definitely get behind. This message has been brought to you by an indian man.
author: Navdeep D.

description: What better way to settle down after work and Chai in a ceramic cup and saucer next to the Chai wallahs than to purchase a snack or soup.  Being in Chai Bar after five months makes me feel right at home where everyone in business knows my name.  Since their Chai lab has set up, I only came for free samples.  Most of the time, I purchased a cup per day of signature Chai tea lattes all to help benefit the endangered species.  Now that Chai Bar is one of my best places to visit, I'm going to Chai for another day!
author: Jimmy C.

description:
4/5 but a bonus star for location, atmosphere, and service
I'm always looking for new study spots near the theater as I wait for night shows and I think I just found my favorite spot. Considering I came on a Friday, there were a good number of seats consistently available, mostly on the communal table. They have wifi (it's a bit slow but tolerable if you're just doing basic work), clean restrooms, plus food (salads, sandwiches, onigiri, baked goods, quiche) and drinks. The service is also incredibly friendly and helpful.

Since I was here for a few hours I got to try a couple things. In general nothing blew my mind but I was happy enough with what I got.

For my drinks I couldn't decide between two drinks and they offered to let me "split" a large so I basically got ~1.75 cups of 2 kinds of drinks. The drinks are made of powder but it's definitely not bad, just slightly less clean tasting. 

1) Tortoise Green Tea Chai w/ Macadamia Milk: Despite the description, I found it to be very light and bordering too sweet. The chai flavor was there but not too much. It's simultaneously light and heavy. It was decent but I preferred my second drink more. (3.5/5)

2) Cub Chai w/ Macadamia : This was right up my alley. It was still a bit sweet but it was heavier on the spices and the slight pepperiness in it was wonderful. (4.5/5)

3) Spicy Chashu Onigiri: I ate it cold from the fridge so it's not as good as it could have been. In general it was a bit salty but the pork wasn't dry which was a pleasant surprise. It has a bit of spiciness to it but mainly from the sriracha. (2.5/5)

4) Ham, Brie, Apple Sandwich: This is one of my favorite combinations and the sandwich was still good but I prefer different ratios. This one is heavier on the ham (they chose a nice one that has some bite and isn't too salty), lighter on the cheese, and just right on the apple. Definitely ask for it grilled, the bread they use has a great texture when heated. I think there was also a bit of honey and mustard in there too which was a nice touch. (3.5/5)
