Overall, I love this place. Not everything I ordered was perfect but the general menu selection and atmosphere are so great that it makes up for it. I don't know if I'd go out of my here just to grab something to-go but if I ever need a spot to unwind, I'll definitely drop by again.
author: Vivian C.

description: I don't know what it is but I don't really think that david rio chai is that good. I really want to like this place and the staff is great, super friendly. But the chai is to artificial for me. I was expecting something more authentic but I was way off. I like the concept of a Chai bar and considering the fact that there are a million coffee shops in San Francisco you would think that a chai bar would serve better chai than coffee shops. The ingredients are key and I think thats why I didn't enjoy the chai here. They use too much "fluff" in the powder and I feel like I can taste it. I feel like all the chai's taste the same in some way its like they all have the same base or something. Its a cute place to do work and maybe get a snack or something but I don't think I am going to get chai here again. :/ i guess its just not my cup of tea if you know what I mean.
author: Cindy M.

description:
Delicious chai and. A great variety 
Worker was helpful and helped me to create my own chai variation. 
Highly recommend it 
It's good for people new to chai because of the variety of options and the workers know what they are talking about
author: Tabitha D.

description:
went in on a quiet Tuesday after work super excited to try their teas. I was raised in India and although I am not a tea aficionado I have had 1-2 great cups of chai in my lifetime. 

when you walk in there is a sign that suggests you ask one of their 'chaiwallas' for their recommendation as I did and tried their tortoise green tea chai with macadamia milk which turned out to be a whopping $7! Although the portion was quite large the actual tea tasted more like a horchata and I didn't quite understand what I was drinking. 

To add to this the wifi connection was very weak and I was having better luck with the SF city wifi. 

It was an average experience but the decor is very cute so I will stop by again and hopefully have a better experience.
author: Rachel N.

description: This place has the best selection of chai tea lattes to choose from. I got the "Tiger Spice Chai" and it completely blew me away. The foaming latte is a perfect consistency that introduces the incredible sweet and spicy chai goodness that hits your tastebuds with full force like a perfect storm. This cup of deliciousness was perfect for a afternoon work session with great wifi and atmosphere. The bathroom could be a little cleaner, but fantastic!
author: Wesley H.

description:
This place is poppin!

Everytime I visit the city I try to go here. The Cafe Ole is amazing here and they have cardamom on the side which makes it even better!

Service is friendly and the place is clean.
author: Lovejit K.

description: We've been here a couple times now, and really appreciate the variety of flavors of chai. All their chai powders are for sale here, too.
author: Iris H.

description: I wasn't a big fan of chai until my boyfriend and I stumbled upon this place to use the bathroom and my god, I am so happy we found this place, it's like meant to be. The foam was astonishing! I never knew chai could taste this good. We order the Tiger Spice Chai and it was creamy, tasty and just the right temperature. I wish I took a picture! I also wish this place was closer to my office, I would walk here almost everyday.
author: Hazel I.

description: It's so cute here and the Elephant Vanilla Chai I had was to die for!! I love chai so much so I can't wait to come back and try the other varieties they have! They all look really tasty. Also a nice chill ambience for sitting and getting some work done:)
author: Laura S.

description:
I'm a hip old granny who can hip-hop, be bop and dance till ya drop.

So naturally, I was attracted to Chai Bar which as it's name proclaims is an establishment purely devoted to the art of drinking chai tea. As soon as I walked into this handsome spot, my eyes, heart and tummy grew about a zillion times looking at all of their amazing descriptions of chai tea blend lattes. Everything sounded better than the rest but I decided to go with their signature Tiger Spice Chai with macadamia nut milk for an extra dollar because...Treat Yo'Self.

The latte was a bit sweeter than I would have liked but that did not stop me from drinking every delicious slightly spicy drop. Unlike most cafes which feel the need to serve you scalding hot, potential privates burning drinks, my tea was served at a perfect temperature. 

Two downsides:
+ Most of their products are from a powder and not brewed on-site
+ Out of rice balls and pretty much all food which basically led to a caffeine crash later in the afternoon.
author: Kimberly S.

description: Stumbled upon this hipster place while walking down Market. We ordered a decaf Tiger Spiced Chai with soy milk, and it was pleasantly sweet and mildly spicy, a comforting choice for those who are not a fan of heavily spiced drinks. Cozy place to study or hang out with a friend for the afternoon!!
author: Joy X.

description: Being a huge chai lover, I've been wanting to come to the Chai Bar for awhile. We finally made the trek here over a weekend in cold SF December. I ordered the green tea chai while the S.O. order the Tiger Spice chai. I don't like my chai too spicy so I ordered the green tea chai as it's on the sweeter side, but it may have been too sweet. I think the guide they gave you may have overestimate how spicy the drink is, as even the Tiger Spice chai was quite sweet. Looking forward to going back and trying a spicier chai. But if you like your chai creamy and sweet, this is definitely the spot!
author: Sharon L.

description: Chai Bar gets one star because they have seating and it can be a nice place to meet. It's a Greg concept, that is executed poorly. Most Chao's have little to no flavor or are overly sweet. You can't adjust sweetness. Why? Because they're all premixed powders. If you like a warm glass of sugary flavored milk, this place is just for you!
author: Brian B.

description: This place is great -- the chai lattes and entire beverage menu is amazing and fun and full of flavor. Elephant Vanilla is a must.
author: Abby H.

description: I love chai tea and finding this place nearby where I was staying I thought this is great! They have such a variety of chai teas, I got their original flavor. I wasn't crazy about it, I like a stronger flavor of ginger and cardamom. This was very subtle and also the soy milk added made the drink too sweet. I also got their packets to take home, I need a huge cup to drink it since it's a lot of powder and it's too creamy for my linking.
author: Michee C.

description:
I liked this place so much that I am writing my very first Yelp review ever. 

I am perpetually on the hunt for a great study spot, and happened to find myself in SoMa for the day. After hopping around a couple different local coffee spots which either had no Wifi, not enough seating, or were just a bit too loud, I happened upon this little GEM. The drinks are great, everyone who works there is so nice, the music is not too loud, there is plenty of comfy seating, the bathrooms are clean, and, best of all, there are outlets everywhere. I can't say enough how much I liked this spot. I got the dirty tiger spice chai and it was perfect.
author: Ellie A.

description:
Wow just what I needed after a long week on a Friday.  So glad I choose this over a bar to get my night started.

Yeah Tiger Chai is da bomb.
author: Tim N.

description: It's a modernized version of Chai and good in my opinion.  If you are looking for "authentic" aka not changed from the original stuff, this may not be what you're looking for.  I highly recommend visiting every so often.
author: JM C.

description:
I absolutely enjoyed the chaiffogato with Tiger Spice--which was around $5

The seating arrangement was largely "booth style" with some bar seatings. Outlets, from my observations, were mainly situated near the booths/cushion seats. It's a good place to catch up with friends or do work on your laptop. They also have wine and beer.

I would definitely come back to try their chai drinks. Would recommend. :)
author: Janet T.

description:
Cool concept and a great place for chai enthusiasts!! 

They have some great chai options with various spice levels that will appeal to all sorts of varied palate!
author: P P.

description:
I love love this place, especially since there are various Chai Tea/Lattes to try out & enjoy! I tried the Tiger Spice Chai Latte, and it's definitely one of my favorite chai lattes ever. I recommend trying this, along with the Cub or Elephant chai lattes, too.

Next time, I would love to try out the Speakeasy beer with chai spices (Speakeasy ChaiIPA*). I love Speakeasy, so it would be interesting to try one out with their chai spices. I didn't get to try one today because it was sold out already. Must be really popular drink from there, too! I would love to come here again and hang out longer.
author: Vivian L.

description:
Think hipster coffee shop meets trendy bar, decides they really want to read a book together, sipping on some chai. 

They have a wide selection of beers on tap, an open space with ample seating that looks conducive to large groups. Plenty of comfy cushions for reading and/or checking out people reading. 

There is a strong chai line up, and while I'm not the best chai drinker I really enjoyed their dirty chai. It's a great concept and I would definitely be back EXCEPT...

..that it closes at 7. So please close later!
author: Jonathan Y.

description:
I am not your basic, coffee-cup-clutching girl. I usually stick with my plain water to get me through the day. However, since I missed my Caltrain and needed to kill some time, I decided to stop by the Chai Bar since it caught my eye when I walked passed earlier on the street.

I got the Super Chai with soy milk because it seemed to be the most mellow since I'm not really into a lot of spices. Even though there was only 1 person making all the drinks, my chai came out pretty fast! Kinda pricey at ~$4.50 for 12 oz, but expected for SF. I thought my chai was pretty good. Like a latte but with a kick. I wouldn't drink it everyday but I'd say it was worth my money to try.

Overall, Chai Bar is spacious, has plenty of natural lighting, is clean and has comfortable seating with lounge pillows that still look new (i.e. not stained, sticky, or just plain nasty).

I'm not much of a chai person but I'd recommend a stop if you're looking for a spot to study or kill some time while sipping on some quality chai.
author: Sylvia Y.

description:
I recently tried the Market breakfast sandwich. 

It was definitely fresh tasting, and all the ingredients went well together. But it would have been better if it had cheese and at just under $10 with tax, was a bit over priced. 

The ambiance of this place is good, but everything is a bit overpriced.

The sandwich also left a weird mayonnaise after taste in my mouth. I am not sure what was up with that.
author: Ashley M.

description:
If you only like a hint of sweetness, get the Cub Chai! I was worried it wouldn't be sweet enough since it's the second to least next to the one that's completely unsweetened, but it was perfect. I got a large with almond milk and it was so delicious I could've drank two! 

Minus 1 star because it was $6 and the almond croissant was dry and not worth the calories. I'll definitely come back for that Cub Chai though, yummmm.
author: Kristen T.

description:
Delicious chai! Subtly sweet and spicy unlike any chai you'll get at Starbucks. Definitely worth the trip! Mid-century modern decor inside.

Also, Chai Bar uses all compostable cups, utensils, takeout boxes, etc. and also partners with the International Fund for Animal Welfare so you can feel good and know that you're helping make the world a better place by going here :)
author: Jeffrey H.

description:
Come to this place if you are a chai lover!
-Wide selection of chai latte and tea
-Large and spacious
-Nice music
-Big tables with outlets to work and study
-Nice atmosphere, not too loud and not too quiet
-Pick Elephant Vanilla Chai latte if you want something extra sweet.
author: Brenda Jiwon L.

description:
Updating my previous review:
The manager Jodet was super sweet and informed me that the barista who made the orders when I came in this past Saturday used Macadamis Nut milk but she felt bad she ran out so the glasses weren't filled to the brim. That was why she gave us the super sweet reward cards.  So my review is now 5 stars.  I will definitely return and, more importantly, I appreciate that this place actually cares about its customers.  Kudos! :-D
author: Monica J.

description:
Very happy to have discovered this place! They have been open for 2 months now.

Extremely spacious place with very pretty decor.. Ordered the "cub chai" and find it brilliant! Sweet but with a kick of spice.. is working wonders for my throat.

Super friendly staff, and free wifi.
author: Aditya M.

description:
Market Street needs good cafes with a hip vibe and relaxed ambiance like this one, so go spend some time and money at Chai Café. 

I actually don't care for the chai spice flavor, but that was no problem here. They offer a dizzying array of tea options. I asked the friendly barista to recommend something for me and ended up enjoying a unique and flavorful iced tea named after a local foodie celebutante. 

If you're here to chat or people-watch and the weather is nice, try the outside tables on bustling Market Street. If you're here to work, spread out at the communal table. Be sure to grab your free wifi password at the counter when you order.
author: Kristy L.

description: The chai lattes are all amazing but what's even better is the service. Every experience I've had here has been really great and the people are so friendly! Awesome environment and wide space too.
author: Heejae P.

description: This place is a hole in the wall. I must admit I'm not a chai latte connoisseur, but this place has great tasting chai latte. I also got a croissant, and I must say that these are close to the best croissant I've had in SF.
author: Josh Giosue D.

description:
I'm so glad that chai is finally getting all the love and attention it deserves right on Market Street. Since it was my first time here, I decided to go with the basic Tiger Spice with non-fat milk. I was a little iffy about whether to order whole or nonfat and the cashier advised that the mixes taste great with just water, so nonfat milk would not take away from it's richness. And boy, was she right! I would have to say this was a much sweeter chai than I'm normally used to. Also, kind of wish it was hotter; it was basically a nudge above lukewarm. 

This would actually be a great place to meet someone on a first date, or a place to hang out in the afternoon to write a blog entry. Really lovely, earthy, and peaceful.
author: Natasha P.

description: Definitely pricy. I ordered the classic chai. It was good. Not the best chai I have ever had. But definitely worth trying at least once. I'll be back to try the other Chai favors. They also sell beer and wine which is cool. They should totally start selling, "Dirty Chai"s with alcohol though.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
Chai Bar by David Rio is quite lovely. It is spacious and I found it to be ideal for bigger groups. I found the staff to be very friendly and I also appreciated that they carried some basic healthy food items as well as some non-chai tea options.

When it comes to the actual Chai drinks though -  I was disappointed to read through many of their not so impressive ingredients. Nearly all of their chai drinks (if you read the labels on their packaged chai) are made with what seems to be fairly processed ingredients and there is quite a bit of sugar in them. Even if you opt for a sugar free chai - if you are drinking non-dairy milk - you'll find that many of their nut milks etc - are also pre-sweetened. That being said - their frothy Chai drinks are tasty and perfect for windy San Francisco days.

If you want to treat yourself  to a comforting and sweet drink with some quality Market Street people watching - I recommend swinging by Chai Bar.

Trust
author: Jessica T.

description:
Although the chai is astounding (along with their muffins), what really spurred me to write this review was a kind of act of a barista. 

After noticing my consistent dry cough, one barista brought me a little ginger, honey, mint mixture to soothe my throat. Now that's next-level customer service.
author: Andrew L.

description:
Drinks are pricey, but reasonable for such a great spacious cafe that isn't too crowded or obnoxious. Perfect spot to read in, with comfortable leather couches that don't look disgusting, and they have Wifi if you want to work here.


---- DRINKS ----

Tiger Chai: 4 stars
Not very spicy actually. As sweet as the vanilla chai.

Elephant Chai: 4.5 stars
Great vanilla chai, similar to the one at Donkey Coffee in Athens, OH. My partner says the dirty version tastes real good and still chai-like for having espresso in it.

Flamingo Chai: 4.5 stars
The Elephant chai's sugar-free skinny cousin, and it still tasted great.

White Shark Chai: 4.5 stars
Yummy, spicy but not as sweet as the Tiger. I got it with 2% milk.


---- LUNCH ----

Vegetable Quiche: 4 stars


---- BAKED GOODS ----

Chocolate Chip Cookie: 3.5 stars
Standard.


Though it pains me to pay $4.50 for a regular-sized drink, which is part of why I dislike The Mill, the horrible ambience there and the soothing one here is what won me to Chai Bar. Also the fact that I don't take caffeine or coffee means I get a lot more drink options at Chai Bar.
author: Letitia L.

description:
H and I were passing through this area when we randomly stumbled across this location while looking for a good dessert location after our HUGE brunch (can we both eat or what....??). Both of us are NOTORIOUSLY in LOVE with ALL THINGS CHAI so OF COURSE, this location peaked our interest IMMEDIATELY. H and I timidly peeked our heads into the bar, hoping to see what this bar was all about (...do they really specialize in chai??...seemed a little TOO good to be TRUE...). 

Luckily, an incredibly KIND, HELPFUL, FRIENDLY  man (who later introduced himself as Louise) called out to us to enter the bar. Louise treated us to INCREDIBLE service -- explaining to us how the chai bar worked (lots of different options for chai....). H and I didn't even know where to begin so Louise was kind enough to make us samples of our drink of choice (Cub Chai). Louise ended up making FULL SIZE CUB CHAI DRINKS for us FOR FREE (because he was convinced we would love it enough to return....). The Cub Chai was delicious -- very spicy. creamy, and not very sweet. I was also able to sample the Tiger Chai which was sweeter than the Cub, equally creamy, with a slightly different Chai taste (not as spicy). In the end, I preferred the Tiger to the Cub.

H and I stayed in the bar for a while, utilizing the big, comfy seats. We saw lots of couples on dates at the bar, and students studying at the tables. This "bar" really seemed to be the perfect location for all. Chai bar even serves alcohol (I think I saw a Chai beer??) -- what a CUTE, PERFECT, and UNIQUE idea for a date in the city. H and I mourned the fact that we both live SO far from the city -- neither of us know of any other locations REMOTELY similar to Chai Bar. *cries* Hopefully Starbucks will be able to tide me over until I can come back and get my hands on another TIger Chai. 

We absolutely LOVED our experience here. Chai Bar is SUCH a NOVEL concept -- a MUST TRY for those who LOVE CHAI.
author: Christine H.

description: I was on my way to Blue Bottle when Chai Bar caught my attention with its perfect lighting and elegant design. The moment I ordered and sat down, I was pleasantly surprised with the best customer service. This is an ideal place to meet up with a friend or two to catch up and enjoy each other's company because the noise level is on the low-moderate side. It's also great if you're just hanging out alone in the city and want a comfortable space to read a book or work on a project. I order the Tiger Spice Chai, and it is one of the best I've ever had (I'm guilty of almost always ordering a chai tea latte when I go to a cafe). I suggest this place for a light lunch or tea, not if you're ravenous. I hope you get a chance to enjoy one of their delicious chai tea lattes.
author: Soohyun Y.

description:
Holy craparoni! This place is seriously amazing. Whether you're a chai connoisseur or not, Chai Bar will cater to your every taste bud. 

The couch tables are so comfortable and the vibe is very upscale casual -- would make a great spot for an afternoon date, catching up on some work on a fine Sunday, or a catchup session with a lovely friend (which is what I did).  

I was craving something creamy and delicious so I ordered the Elephant Vanilla Chai Latte with Macadamia Nut Milk. Dear god is all I have to say. The drink was oozing with flavor, so creamy, had just the right amount of sweetness (not disgustingly sweet but more moderate) and was complete perfection in a cup. The Macadamia Nut Milk definitely adds to the creaminess and milkshake-like texture so I'd highly recommend this add-on. 

My friend got a Cub Chai and loved it as well. 

Definitely head here when you're craving a delicious chai latte or you just want something hot and yummy to drink -- you won't regret it! 

Happy Drinking, Yelpers!
author: Priya S.

description:
Pretty good chai. Terrible customer service. I'm not sure if the chai is enough of a reason to deal with the pretty rude "chai-ristas" here, especially in a city with tons of coffee and tea places. 

I ordered the elephant vanilla chai with almond milk. It was good, creamy and full of flavor but too sweet for my taste even though it says "lightly sweet".

The service is really slow and I didn't come when it was that busy. I saw 6 drinks on the counter so went up and asked if they called my name. The lady said to wait and was going to call them in order or else she would get confused. Uhh... I'm no barista but I'm pretty sure calling out names with the corresponding drinks can't be too hard.
author: Krishna S.

description: Love it! They have a long list of chai as well as beer on tap. We tried the elephant and tiger chai and both were delicious. As a bonus they have comfy seats and a chai lab where they host small classes to learn how to do latte foam art.
author: L E.

description: Really wonderful staff and generous space in the midst of mid-Market St chaos. A lovely sanctuary for a cup of quick chai or long study sessions. They have WiFi and their menu stays fresh.... I wish they still served onigiri but now they have boba!! And of course a million flavors of chai. What a treat.
author: Rosanna C.

description: Had a chai with a friend. Love the idea of the chai. I order the cub. Real delicious food.
author: Shivaji D.

description: This is a nice place. It makes you forgot that you are near 6th and Market. It has a wonderful and hip ambiance. Friendly customer service and delicious chai.  I ordered the Tiger Spice Chai with almond milk, it was well made. It was spicy and had the right amount of creaminess. The interior of the store looked modern and clean. I looked forward to coming back and trying  out the other flavors.
author: Hiroshi K.

description: Messed up our order two times, still ended up with a drink with dairy in it we didn't order. No food available to order which we also came for. Chai iced tea we ended up with was ok, but not worth $6 dollars.
author: Kevin B.

description: I stopped in as they were closing and still they served me, were friendly and helpful. I ordered an elephant chai ( honey and vanilla) and for $4.50 it was delicious absolutely perfect, creamy, sweet and flavorful.
author: Victoria N.

description: I had a really enjoyable experience here. There's about 9 different chai selections that varies from sweet to spicy, and the barista is there to help you order. The drinks are on the pricier end, but definitely worth a try. I tried the Elephant Vanilla Chai, and it definitely pleases the more sweet palate. I'm looking forward to trying the other flavors next time.
author: Minette C.

description: I had the vanilla chai and it was pretty good.  I also had the wrap for lunch, not quite as good as the chai but a nice place to go to for a lunch break.  Very spacious too.
author: a f.

description:
Chai Bar is the best!
Great space, great location, great people.
I tasted most of the base line, awesome verity, perfect sweetness. I'm excited.
Gonna visit soon again :)
author: Lulu B.

description: We are staying very close to here. This place is incredible! Service very friendly and informative! Great quiches which they get from a local bakery! At times lines are constant, but fast and efficient...worth the wait!!
author: Hanne R.

description:
The atmosphere of Chai is gorgeous with plush seating, beautiful plants, outdoor seating,  lovely lighting, and nice floors. Chai has style with a contemporary feel....

When i come in here I really expect the staff to have proper product knowledge, and the ability to recommend a drink that I am in the mood for.

My first experience was a bit of a miss but my second visit was very good - I got great customer service, a suggestion, and a friendly short and sweet conversation. I was impresses by a lovely lass who knew her business which left me feeling happy and comfortable.
author: Julian I.

description: delicious chai and tons of seating at this cafe.  the tiger chai was so rich and creamy, and they do not charge extra for soy!  they have a lot of other nut milks that sounded good (and they do charge for those), but i didn't realize it until i already ordered.
author: Helen T.

description: Huge location, with a clean inviting interior with plenty of room. If I was younger, I would probably study here at some point- that's the type of atmosphere. The chai itself was... chai. It wasn't bad, it wasn't world-changing. It was just chai. I suppose if I tried some of the more esoteric flavors I would have a different opinion, but I went with the spicy chai, which wasn't that spicy. The customer service was a little odd- some were really friendly and some were very off-putting. I suppose if I need chai and I'm in mid-market, I'll go here again, but I'm not sure why else I would return.
author: Samir K.

description: I work right next to Chai Bar and we always get chai from here for our meetings or office events and I've been into the store a couple times to try their drinks, but it's not for me. I've had my share of chai and I feel like the drinks here are a bit water down and the chai flavor is not as prominent as I like it to be. On a positive note, the space is very large and spacious and great if you want to work here.
author: Cindy A.

description: Delicious Elephant Vanilla Chai with macadamia nut milk! Definitely a great treat and I would go back again. Only thing that would be better is the ability to choose the level of sweetness. Its extremely sweet, like a sugar high sweet. It would be awesome to have options for unsweetened, lightly sweet, semi sweet, and regular (the way it is today).
author: Jenna M.

description:
I'd give Chai Bar 5 stars if I based it solely on their namesake. If you're in a grab and go situation, I recommend trying this place. I've had the Elephant Vanilla Chai with almond milk and Tortoise Green Tea Chai. Both were delicious. 

I'm subtracting two stars because of the service. The girl at the counter was more concerned with talking to her friend than taking my order. When it was time to close, she complained loudly about why they were still taking orders. She also loudly told her friend in the store that she would let him stay after she kicked everyone else out. Her words, not mine. I ultimately regretted tipping her.

I'm subtracting another star because store hours on the door are incorrect. It lists they are open until 7 pm on Sundays but we were told to leave at 6 pm.

This could be a great place to enjoy some chai and work on things because the ambiance is nice (plus the seats along the wall are padded which is always good for those longer laptop sessions) but it's just not there yet.
author: Simone P.

description:
What a find! We randomly stumbled across this place while walking on Market Street, and it's quite literally the most spacious tea or coffee house I've ever seen! 

That being said, this place is delicious! After pondering the extensive chai menu, I settled on the Elephant Vanilla Chai with nonfat milk (they have a decent selection of flavored and non-flavored milks to choose from). 

The chai was creamy, and also sweeter than I initially thought it would be - but regardless, delicious! If you're looking for the authentic "Indian chai" - maybe not so much the place - but David Rio's version of chai was still pretty great. Perfect for San Francisco on a cold day (on a hot day, opt for an iced version).

I will most definitely be back the next time I'm in the area! What a great alternative to coffee.

P.S. If you're really into coffee, Chai Bar does have a coffee menu albeit not as extensive as the chai menu.
author: Mansi A.

description: This place really really sucks! There is no other way to describe how horrible it is.   People, do not go here. The taste is terrible. It is bland and you can taste the powder. I'd rather have chai enthusiasts make a trip to Asha Tea House or samovar (although no place compares to the authentic chai made at home with freshly grated ginger and fresh aromatic cardamom ).  This place is an insult to chai, to India, and to anyone who knows better than to drink powdered chai! I guess your company can sell its mediocre powder to Quickly- as they love unauthentic powdered drinks. Thanks David, and your wife Rio, for promoting a false understanding of chai. My Indian friends and community are repeatedly appalled at this kind of product. I am upset to see cafes in Berlin and Mexico using this nasty powder. Please stop sending this unauthentic, commercialized, tasteless, unhealthy, bogus powder to others.
author: EatVegetarian F.

description: Great place to study. It's quiet with plenty of tables and reliable wifi. However, the chai itself is way too milky for my taste. The variety of options is intriguing and the assortment of pastries looks good, but I couldn't finish my beverage.
author: Rhea M.

description: I hate that I found this place because every other chai is forever ruined and it looks like I'll being making the ghetto a more frequent destination.  Had an iced tiger w 2% milk... love that they tell you the sweet vs spicy ratio and the kicker- they have the thick boba straws... perfect for chugging!  Try this at your own risk- a $6 chai addition is no joke.
author: CJ T.

description:
I don't understand the hype here. This spot is for hipsters. I'd rather go to the Chai Cart for better tasting chai tea. The chai is not spicy. The Elephant chai is TOO SWEET regardless of which milk you choose (yes, I tried it with the +$1 macadamia nut milk too). 

It's cute and the vibe is cool, but I came for chai tea and this was not chai tea.
author: Joi J.

description: Chai heaven. So many kinds to try. Amazing place to sit and work. Friendly staff. Has an all around great vibe to it.
author: Sarah F.

description:
Wow. I love it. This Tea Bar is bright, wide open, ultra clean, and has a fantastic variety. Staff is extremely friendly and service is very fast. He is not cheap, but you get what you pay for.

Ginger mint honey tea has huge slices of fresh ginger.
author: scott h.

description:
Chai Bar has the best chai I've ever had. 

Their power chai with almond milk is so delicious and fresh, I've never tasted anything like it before! It even beats the masala chai with soy milk I've had so many times before. 

I was never that big a fan of chai until I got a chance to try this amazing drink. 

The house granola is also a treat! 

Be sure to try this place if you want filling, delicious, fresh and satisfying chai!
author: Shalini P.

description: I love this spot! Their customer service is superb. I had something wrong with my fruit and they brought out this beautiful bowl with double the original fruit! I'll def be back :)
author: Christine L.

description:
Went here today after seeing the menu. I was not super impressed but maybe its because I was basing it off what I thought what a macchiato was. I walked over with my coworker and we both got the matcha matchiato which is $3.50 each. He also got the spam masubai or in their case the onigiri still. 

I was extremely underwhelmed by the matchiato. For $3.50, the cup was like 1/3 filled with match and then a dollop of the milk foam. maybe cause i was thinking of what I get when I go to starbucks but I was expecting milk to be mixed it. Taste wise, it was eh. However, they did whisk it in a bowl. 

In terms of ambience, its a nice place. Very clean and modern. A lot of places to sit. They sell prepacked salad as well as different onigiri. Menu is extensive and they will have a design your own chai in the near future. 

wasn't very impressed honestly but i felt jipped paying $3.50 for 1/3 cup of green tea basically.
author: Tao Tao W.

description: I think a chai bar is a really neat concept, and this place does a great job! I tried both the original Tiger Spice Chai, and the Elephant Vanilla Chai, and I loved the Tiger Spice Chai! (The Vanilla flavor was a little too sweet for my taste) They also give you the option to use soy milk or almond milk (extra 50 cents), and I really like how the almond milk tastes with the chai! The interior is spacious and looks great, with a lot of comfortable seating and what looks to be good workspaces.
author: Audrey G.

description: This is THE place to go if you like Chai. It is located a block from bart and muni. If you want a nice place to meet someone, study or have a nice brunch it's very spacious and relaxing. Everything is on point. The people are super nice. The Chai is amazing and their food is excellent. Everything is run very well. I have zero complaints and nothing but praise for Chai Bar.
author: Katy H.

description:
I don't like  the register girl with the blonde bangs,
She was very rude to me I spent the worst half of an hour just watching her disrespect costumers I have seen her working for the past week and she appears to have gotten worse at her job


From now on if I see the blonde girl working I will not give this establishment my service, I would rather walk two blocks to the nearest Starbucks then deal with this girl.
author: Mike M.

description: I'm not really a big fan of chai so I had the Steph Curry - a nice, refreshing iced drink with black tea, lemon and spices!  It hit the spot!  Customer service was friendly and quick, and I like this location on Market near Jones.  It's a bright, cheery shop with lots of space to sit, enjoy your drinks and study/work, meet your friends, what have you.
author: Maile N.

description:
Service and Space:
The moment I entered this place, I fell in love. Chai Bar lives up to its name--it is, indeed, a bar, and one that serves wine and beer. Better yet, it serves tea, coffee, and chai tea. That last option is what makes this place one of my favorite stops in SF. There are seatings for those who just want to lounge around a table with their friends, but also a bar for frequenters to sit down and order their dose of caffeine or alcohol.

The workers switch in between bartending and barista vibes. They're perfectly happy modifying your drink to your heart's content, and I've also seen them converse with regular patrons with nothing but the utmost geniality. In any case, I'm impressed that the barista who took my order was patient enough to answer all of my questions about the tea and milk content. 

Speaking of which...

Milk:
Can't get enough of the milk options--this was the first place I've had macadamia nut milk. If you're looking for a more chocolate, Nutella-esque taste to your drink, ask for the hazelnut option.

Chai:
- Chocolate Chai: A Tiger Spice Chai with with cocoa, and only slightly sweet for those who want a chocolate delicacy without too much sugar. The balance between cocoa and chai is just right, since the chocolate doesn't overwhelm other flavors. 
- Bubble Chai: I'll admit--I only got this to taste the pearls, which were just average. I chose to get this with the Power Chai, to get a more milk tea taste.
- Boldly Spiced Chai: Since I'm such a fan of unsweetened drinks, this extremely strong chai is one of my top choices whenever I head here. You can ask for some sweetener added to this drink if you're a fan of the extra spice.
- Power Chai: Matcha and chai, my two favorite flavors, mixed together? Sure, it's an odd combo at first, but if you're looking for an earthier taste to your chai tea, this is a solid option.

Food:
Not only are the drink options phenomenal, the food provided at Chai Bar is even better. 
- Onigiri: You can select from sushi rice, or Chai Bar's own rice, which takes these rice balls to an entirely new level. Although the teriyaki options are delicious, my favorite is the pickled plum. If you're more willing to embrace the fusion side of this cuisine, then go for the umeboshi with the mixed rice.
- Soup: Slightly overpriced, but the standout soup between all the options is the roasted red pepper and gouda. I'm not the biggest fan of cheese, but the addition of this delightful dairy makes an otherwise underwhelming soup slightly richer.

I'm going to be honest: I'm looking forward to more trips to this side of the city just to show off Chai Bar to my friends. I'll only slightly regret how ridiculous (but delicious) this place is. Oh, Happy Hour serves alcohol? Maybe I'll come for that... but for now, I'd rather get the chai.
author: Kat P.

description: I really like chai, and being able to order a few different types is nice. I find myself here more often than not when I'm waiting for people, and it happens to be by union.
author: Linh D.

description: Had an elephant vanilla Chia latte during lunch break. Definitely like it and will go again!
author: Ivan C.

description: This was my first time at Chai Bar by David Rio...I ordered the Elephant Vanilla Chai with Macadamia Nut Milk...it was so amazing...I need more of this Chai in my life. I've been wanting to come back here so for my second visit, I ordered the Chocolate Chai with Macadamia Nut Milk with a caramel waffle cookie. DELICIOUS!!!
author: Ardees R.

description: This place is amazing. Clean, comfortable and the chai selection is fantastic. I also love that you can purchase their chai to make at home.
author: Casey C.

description:
The chai was good.  I was expecting a steeped chai rather than just steamed powders, but it wasn't bad.  I love that they have a variety of milks (soy, almond, macadamia nut) available.  

The atmosphere is great, super chill and comfy.  The only thing is the service.  The baristas basically tune out any questions or interaction with the customers.  I watched this happen again and again as I sat at the bar for an hour.  

Overall, not bad, but not sure if it's worth the price and service.
author: Sasha R.

description:
What's more pretentious and hipster than an SF coffee bar? An SF chai bar.

I was ready to hate-review this place after interacting with the sleepy toe-gazing cashier who was resting her chin on both of her elbows. But after tasting their signature chai I was converted. Their chai is actually pretty good. I know it's bad for me and I don't want to see the ingredients. Let me just have this sip of frothy heaven for one good second. Ahhhh.
author: Michael H.

description:
WHERE HAS THIS PLACE BEEN MY WHOLE LIFE!?

And of all places for it to be, ACROSS FROM A THEATER!?

This place is chai heaven. But they also offer other caffeinated drinks, plus beer and wine. And some food. But you come here for the CHAI!

A dozen different kinds, including a green tea chai and a chocolate chai! The atmosphere is adorable. You can sit at the actual bar, which is pretty big, or grab a seat at a smaller table in their lounge-type seating area. Very spacious place!  

They offer a few unique types of non-dairy milk which I thought was really cool - macadamia nut, hazelnut and rice, in addition to almond and soy (plus regular dairy milk). I opted for regular 2% because I was craving a nice frothy drink, but I've heard that the macadamia nut milk has the same effect so I'll definitely be trying that next time!

Definitely a cute place to grab a drink before a show at the SHN Golden Gate, go on a date, or have a party/shower. And it's definitely a nice little haven if you find yourself in that part of town by accident and you need a safe place to chill.
author: Ashley C.

description:
Yummy chai!
Got the tiger spice chai which was nice and creamy. Very balanced. Will be back to try the different options. 

The place is pretty cute too. 

They also serve alcohol of that's your thing.
author: Heejin L.

description:
This concept is golden. I was in San Francisco for a period of like 4 days and still managed to make time to hit this place up 3 times. The staff are really nice, I love their chai and the fact that I can get a great cup of chai with hazelnut milk was absolutely awesome. This is the first location to open up, but I have no doubt that this chain will quickly popup all over the country soon enough. 

I took all of my drinks to go - but the cafe itself is spacious and offers up a lot of seating. There is beer and wine on offer if that is more your game. Definitely a cool place to relax and get some work done in.
author: Damon A.

description: I went there every once a week or sometimes a couple of times a week. Mostly because it's that spicy chai is good and environment is nice.
author: Donna Z.

description:
Yum vanilla chai tea, best boba I have had by far.

Ya feel me?
author: Johnny L.

description: This place is very very unfair i was told I had to purchase a coffee after standing in a long line for a long time (this was on pride day) i was told to get out of line and that I have to make another line to purchase something because I can't use the bathroom without showing a receipt I bought something in order for me to use the restroom. I explained I just had my period and I have to use it and I was going to buy something after I got out of restroom, but I was told I had to get a receipt before I use it. What kind of ppl do this? It's not my fault I'm a woman and I get periods this should be illegal to Deprive women of basic needs. I am never going back to this nasty  place and you shouldn't either.When I told the manager about it he turned his back on me because obviously he doesn't care and he needed to keep making a coffee for somebody else so he can keep making money without caring for his customers cause all he cares is about money and not people.
author: Maria B.

description:
Great chai drinks! Has alot of options with different ways to personalize your drinks (a bunch of milk choices) 

I would have rated a 5 but they dont have many pastry options.

If you like Chai tea, this is a must visit.
author: Jaye P.

description:
I love this place! This is currently my fav place for chai. Try the chai chocolate if you want something that makes you happy!
The blonde girl at the cash register is very sweet and helpful. 5 stars!
author: Fabiola G.

description: Fun, lovely, hip, lots of chai options, macadamia milk. Can't wait until you can make your own chai!
author: Andrew K.

description:
As far as chai bars go, this is the only one I've been to, and it's set the bar!
Expect an assortment of chai lattes, ranging from sweet, to spicy, to chocolatey, to coffee-y, to zen (think matcha/green tea). I wish they'd had a flight so I could try them all. Suppose more visits will be necessary instead ;)

I have tried the chocolate and tiger (sweet) ones to date, and my favorite is definitely the tiger, for a sweet, subtly spiced, snuggly sip. I also tried their butternut squash quiche, which was tasty, although I would have preferred blended squash to chunks of it.

The seating at Chai Bar is interesting- a very open atmosphere where you can expect to easily people-watch (or puppy-watch, seriously), or get some work done.

There's also a chai beer and wine that I'd be eager to try after 5pm, when this place turns from cafe to bar. Hooray for dual-purpose establishments!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
I was overwhelmed by the options here, only got a chance to try two different chai's (and zero beers, sadly!). Both chai's I got were amazingly crafted and better than any chai I've ever had from a chain. Funny, just realized the word 'chai' is in the word 'chain'. ANYWAY!

I would definitely go back next time I'm in SF. The chai scene is obviously a growing one, especially in Silicon Valley, but this place has set the bar for my evolving love of chai.
author: Kirk B.

description:
this place is super yum~

always go for the tiger spice chai, so warm and delicious!
author: Tiffany S.

description:
When doing a random walk down market street in the morning before work the Chai bar caught my eye and I had to stop in. I was enamored with the decor and the friendly wait staff from the beginning. I am a chai fan and not really a coffee fan so it was a welcome sight to see something dedicated to coffees mistreated younger brother. I only did a chai in the morning so I can't speak to the happy hour or bar set up in the evening. However the place is very spacious and the ample seating and bar standing space would lend itself well to this. 

The prices were all under ten dollars and there was an amazing variety of Chai options. I didn't even know there were that many outside of green tea. There are spicy options and sweet options and the sweetness is indicated on the menu as well. I had the Green Tortoise Chai and it was absolutely delicious. I paid my 5 dollars and had a warm cup of Chai goodness in my handing in about two minutes. The morning crowd wasn't too rushed so you can sit and enjoy the quiet or people watch out of the front windows. It was by far the best Chai I have ever had and I cannot wait to try some of the other flavors. 

Like many of the others are saying the WIFI could definitely use some love and I am not sure its something you could do consistent work on. But if you are looking to grab a quick Chai without the hustle and bustle of a starbucks this is the place. Where Starbucks feels like a walmart of coffee this is your whole foods of coffee and worth it to stop by when you get the chance.
author: Nick R.

description: Loved the flavor of my Flamingo Vanilla Chai.  It was very think and creamy.  A little overly sweet. Didn't taste like true chai but yummy.
author: Thang H.

description: The interior is very sleek and the staff were friendly. You could happily spend a few hours here. The chai is tasty but very pricey. If you like super sweet chai lattes (and who doesn't, on occasion) this is the place for you but if you're a chai tea purest you won't be too impressed.
author: Mia M.

description: I basically don't like the places which gives 1 hours complimentary wifi. Especially after charging $6 for average chai latte. I was their regular customer just because convenience of their location but not anymore. I have tons of options to go for a decent coffee with unlimited free wifi on market st. So if you are looking for a place to work couple hours, go somewhere else. This place is very annoying and mean when it comes to sharing their so presious wifi with their customers.
author: Osman K.

description:
Update!!

I unfortunately could not return to the Chai Bar recently, however a friend of mine did, and they said that the musubi has much improved, and they even brought one back for me!

After being contacted by the Chai bar and being told that the recipe has improved, I was quite impressed with how quickly they got back to me saying they have improved, and encouraged to return to sample them again. Unfortunately I lack the time to return, however upon mentioning to a friend, they kindly came by after visiting (it's quite a long ways away, worth devoting half an entire day to) since they had business in SF, and gave me one. It was marvelous, the flavored were simple and delicious, I could perhaps taste just a tiny, very small amount of sesame oil, however it was delicious, and not at all overpowering as it was before. I'm very pleased with this change, and should I visit San Fracisco again, I'll definitely make sure to stop by the Chai Bar.
author: Sean F.

description: Chai Bar is a super cute cafe in a not so cute part of town. So already there is a bit of unsettling vibes when you're paying almost $5 for a chai latte and while looking at the window you're seeing tons of homeless people. So the gentrification is real and this place is just another reminder of that. The chai is good, don't get me wrong but the pastries are not. This place is just missing something more to make it delicious and worth the $5 latte .
author: Chelsea S.

description: Went to tiger Chai bar today and the service was really good also their chai as well. Staff members are very friendly. You can also sit outside on a nice day. They also have pastries and sandwiches. Prices are good.
author: Sal S.

description:
It's gotten worse!!! Chocolate Chai is no longer on the menu. Now you have to pay $.50 extra for chocolate. So $5.00 now... I don't like it
And I got a yogurt parfait and the yogurt is old and clumpy.
author: Marley M.

description:
Kind expected the salads to be fresh made and not packaged... Salads dont contain enough dressing for the size.Other then that this place is a little bit of alright. 

Also ordered the earl grey milk tea... It was nice a little dull on flavor but refreshing. 

Nice staff! 

Not anything special however the ambience is a little soothing.
author: Abraham A.

description: I love this place, and I'm surprised to find that it's a very comfortable and quiet environment for a Saturday afternoon work session: they have outlets underneath the seats! Would definitely try to come back again!
author: Yuki J.

description:
This place has got great atmosphere. Its feels cozy and its perfect for this oncoming autumnal weather.

 Let me just say. I have the a few of David Rio's mixes and obviously a mix is not as good as getting it freshly made at the Chai Bar. Chai is such a comforting drink to sip on especially when the weather is starting to get chilly. The baristas here are super helpful. 

I went with the sweet route and opted for the Vanilla Chai with Soy. Oh man. It is super creamy, sweet but not too sweet and slightly spicy and cinnamony. It tastes like fall in a cup. The small size is $4.50 for a chai which is pretty pricey but nothing crazy compared to all the other coffee shops around the area. Its pretty standard but its worth the splurge every once in a while.

I'd definitely come back.... probably on a rainy day. bundled up in scarces and boots. :)
author: Sam L.

description:
So I've now come to Chai Bar at least ten times, and it's time for a review! 

I found this place on my usual walk to Sightglass coffee...and quickly realized that this place would be my new home base downtown. 10/10 would (and do!!) recommend.

Their location is fantastic. You actually can't do better downtown-it's a block from the northern Powell BART entrance, just far enough that it's not insanely packed 24/7 and just close enough to always be accessible. 

The vibe in Chai Bar is supreme. Their music is always on point, (when I was writing this review: Run the Jewels, Hieroglyphics, the Fugees). About half of the room will be folks doing work on laptops, or talking with friends. The other half is folks meeting up after work, or catching up with friends, or on dates. AND ALSO Chai Bar has super clean bathrooms, and fast wi-fi. For a student trying to work and trying to get her social drink on, this setup could not be better. Did I mention that they have so many outlets, that I've never needed to wait for one? 

Their chai is fantastic, simply because of the breadth and quality of options. You can get chai drinks hot and chilled, at different levels of sweetness and spiciness. They have more traditional offerings, and more adventurous (try the Bubble Chai with boba!). They also have a wide range of milks-your more normal whole milk and soy and almond, but also macadamia nut milk! They also have non-chai tea drinks, both hot and cold. Try the Steph Curry. With clove, cinnamon, and cardamom, you'll thank me later. 

But also; Chai Bar carries a respectable range of alcoholic drinks. Normally, their beer selection will rotate six or seven California craft brews at a time, and a few out of state breweries represented as well. As my home for 3/4 of the year is San Diego, I'm VERY picky about my craft beers. Their selection always incorporates at least 3-4 SD breweries, so I'm always happy! They also have four or so rotating wines. Which isn't really my thing-I'm more of a beer person, BUT people who order wines here are generally happy with the offerings. Source: pretentious friend from Napa who came for a visit a couple months back. 

Service here is seriously fantastic as well. All of the folks who work here are very welcoming, and work to deliver super high quality goods in very short amounts of time. Even when it's been packed, I've never waited more than five minutes for a drink. 

Long story short: if you need somewhere with bomb drinks (and onigiri YESS GIRL YESSS), and wi-fi, and aesthetically pleasing music and seating, Chai Bar is where you should be. The outlets. The chai. The craft beers on tap. The super friendly service. Actually, why aren't you there now?
author: Claire M.

description:
I wasn't expecting much from this place. I was just looking for a place where I can study and luckily I stumbled upon this cute spot on Yelp. The tiger spice chai was INCREDIBLE! Seriously go get it. I don't know how I can drink chai tea from other places now going forward. 

This cafe is pretty big and you can sit at the bar or hang out in their cozy and comfortable lounge seating to study or to catch up with friends. They have some outdoor seating as well.
author: Nin A.

description:
Love this place. Great teas and macadamia milk! Great on a cold day.
The space is beautiful, and they also have beer and wine another plus.
author: Melanie d.

description:
Summary: 

- human service needs a bit more improvement
- bundle your prices into the total cost.  I don't mind paying $7 for Chai, but the thought of being asked for an extra $.50 cents for milk, creamer, etc. is ridiculous
- smile. For premium prices, customer service has to be present
- allow your customers time to make up think mind.  I don't like being told to move aside (with no line behind me)
- I want Chai... not a 1/3 cup of foam high
author: Michael J.

description:
I'm sitting here thanking the heavens that I have finally, finally, FINALLY, found a single place in the entire Bay Area that gives me the same feeling of inspiration, creativity, and comfort that Grace Street and the Union Square Barnes & Noble gave me in New York City. 

After moving to San Francisco a month ago, I have sat in coffeeshop after coffeeshop, tea lounges, co-working spaces, bookstores, (Blue Bottle, Philz, Asha, Plentea, Joy's Place, Craftsman, you name it I've been there), trying to find the right mix of natural light and ambient noise, good food, long hours, wifi, and power outlets, and I have finally found it here. 

Sipping a hot tortoise green tea chai on this big wooden table, hearing the sounds of traffic and laughter outside-- I have finally found my sanctuary.
author: Jane Z.

description: Excellent presence, top notch furniture, superb fung shui decor, and creamy, decadent chai. And the chai you buy saves animals. What gets better than this?
author: Natasha S.

description: If you are into chai (and honestly even if you are not) this is a must place. They have types for every taste and if you are overwhelmed by the choices feel free to ask them for their recommendation. The staff was super friendly and asked me about my sweetness/spiciness preference and then recommended their classic Tiger chai - which in case you had a doubt, was perfect for my taste.
author: Dana N.

description:
The chai line up is seriously one to die for here. I went here after a hike with a friend and ordered an iced Elephant Vanilla Chai. It was a mix of sweet and spicy, and was perhaps one of the most unique drinks I've ever had. 

It seemed like a good place to casually meet someone over a cup of chai or study/do some work as the place was relatively quiet despite being right off of Market. I can also see it being used as a place to go to for a drink right after a meal or an outdoor activity like a hike.

The only thing that I found strange about the place is the way it was laid out. There were very few seats and tables even though there was plenty of room for more. The whole bar setup with the beer and wine taps seemed a little out of place to me but perhaps that was because I went in at around 5 pm. 

Overall, the place was awesome for what it suggests - chai!
author: Hardik A.

description:
I love chai. 
I love how open this place is. 
I love how nice the people behind the counter are. 
I love that they can answer any question I may have about my chai. 
I love going there with a book or with a friend and enjoy a nice evening relaxing.
author: Ezekiel G.

description: Visiting SF for the first time and saw this cafe while walking down the street. Nice location. It had a cute "cafe appeal" from the outside. I got the elephant chai latte with macadamia milk and OMG best chai I have ever had!!! And I'm desi so really the best chai is what my family makes but this was the best store made chai ever. I know chai. My husband got the hot chocolate and loved it. We went back the next day for some more and also split an almond croissant. The almond croissant wasn't bad but I've had better on the east coast. I love the decor and seating inside. Super cute cafe with communal seating and comfy couches. Husband and I both agreed it would be a cute first date place for coffee or even drinks, it seems like they had drinks on tap too! Perfect for if one person wants a drink and the other wants chai. Wifi is through a code they print for you. Overall nice and I really wish they had Chai Bar in NYC by my work! I would probably go a few times a week if they did!
author: Tanzima R.

description: I don't really like chai latte. Most chai latte tastes too sweet. But here you can make your own chai. Personally I really like cub chai :)
author: Irene W.

description:
Took an incredibly daring chance by not Yelping this place first, and shyt, it delivered! Also, experience matched Yelp rating; surprise, said no one. 

The macadamia nut milk is a good idea, as is the spicier chai, because the classic one is ubersweet. The novel-yet-successful boba and chocolate chai smoothie thang both got the thumbs up. Only the cookies were a miss, but there isn't chai in a chocolate chip cookie so don't be an idiot and order one. 

Don't get anything to go, seating rocks. I sat next this dope baby, and boy, did we have a good time enjoying our respective elaborate Chai beverages. The vibes are right on.
author: Rachel R.

description:
My partner and I stopped by here one afternoon a few weeks ago for a light late lunch.  My partner had the Tiger Spice Chai and I had the Tortoise Green Tea Chai.  We also had 2 types of onigiris (Pier 39 and Forbidden City) and 1 sandwich (Powell, which is actually a wrap).  The food are all pre-made and located by the front area. 

For the most part, we enjoyed everything we had.  I just want to mention that my so-called green tea chai mainly taste of vanilla, which was not mentioned as an ingredient used for that item.  When I asked the barista if, perhaps, I received a wrong order, she told me what I got was the correct order.  She also said that if I wanted a stronger (I say, ANY) green tea flavor, I should try the one with matcha next tine instead.  Hmm...

Anyway, it was a pleasant enough experience overall.  It was interesting to have a 'greeter' at this otherwise casual café by the door.  I wonder if the intention is to welcome people in or to keep people out...

We'll stop in again when in the area!
author: Yvette F.

description: Excellent chai teas and really cool ambiance. The interior is clean and modern, baristas are uber friendly and the chai tea's are bomb! Get the elephant vanilla chai..iced. You won't regret it.
author: Samantha S.

description:
What this place lacks in service and product they try to make up for in branding. It's not bad, it's just not as great as it's been rated on here. Service way slower than molasses and had what in my profession would be termed a "restricted" or even "blunted" affect. 

The chocolate chai latte I got was lack luster but palatable. It tasted smoky... maybe slightly burnt. Also, I kind of feel begrudgingly when places charge extra to make my drink lighter on the lactose. (It's tacky in my opinion to charge for special diets, particularly involuntary ones.) Thankfully they offer something other than cheap, crappy nasty soy milk.

But damn did it take a long ass time to order and wait for cup of mediocrity.  Like 25 minutes from getting in line to cup in hand. Do not go here with the intention to catch a train in a little while like I did. It wasn't even busy... only like three people were in line in front of me and there was still open seats to spare.

The place does smell very good and appears to be very clean.... which is good because even if you order to go you will be there a while. If you're very familiar with the area and on your own this also leaves you plenty of solitary meditation time to contemplate all the cheaper, faster places to get a cup of chai. It also leaves time to reconsider one's stance on Starbucks and its merits of often friendly service that is often too fast to debate how tacky you'd feel asking to be refunded so you can leave, sans chai latte, and get on with your life.

This place is mediocre and over branded much like Starbucks, only way slower. It strikes me as the sort of place one would go if they are afraid of the rest of the neighborhood.
author: A J.

description:
The chais here are amazing. And the ambience and sitting place are great as well. 
Try any and all of the options!
author: Nitesh D.

description: I am a big chai tea fan so even though I don't like splurging on coffee/tea beverages (I never get anything other than coffee at places like Starbucks) I had to try this place out. I am so glad I did! Had the boldly chai, which is very spicy and unsweetened. You can have it with or without milk/cream. I had it with steamed milk. It was the best chai tea latte I have ever had! Perfect amount of spice, and not having any sweetener allowed for the chai flavour to really shine through.
author: Chantal T.

description:
At least, at Starbucks people are covered!
We were just walking on Market and thought to have an afternoon coffee. The placed looked nice, so we tried. There was a short line but it took forever to order a coffee, don't know why it must take so long just to take orders for coffees. 
We sat at the counter. There were four people behind the counter just chatting among themselves, so not surprising if they got our order messed up. My cappuccino was really bad, Starbucks or Peet's are way better. It was all watery and tasted just like... bad.

But the worst thing is that,while sipping the cappuccino, we had to look at exposed body parts of the bartenders that I would rather not see. Nothing indecent, of course, but definitely parts of strangers' bodies that I would rather avoid to see.
Bartenders, baristas, whatever you want to call them, should have a minimum level of dressing code when they work in public places and interact with other people. It is a matter of respect toward your customers.
When I go to a meeting with external customers, I am expected to dress in respectful way toward them, I don't show up with skinny yoga pants, flip flops, bare feet, tank tops covering half of my lower torso.
I don't dress formally, but dress respectful for the people around me.
author: Luca R.

description: Okay I was just coming to marinello beauty school to get my hair done and was recommend to stop by here and get the elephant chai vanilla and the lovely lady at the register put me in a good mood, told me all the options I had which most places will skip doing. It was great. I'm biting into my blueberry muffin right now and holy moly it is delicious talk about being crunchy on the outside and soft and moist on the inside. The pricing is great and I will definitely come here more often thank you guys so much.
author: Samantha W.

description:
I like the Green Tea matcha frost!! It was the best blended green tea matcha I have ever had in SF! You should try!! 
Well, in the term of sweetness; it's not as sweet as Starbucks ones or somewhere else's which is why I liked it cause I think it's more healthier and oh no whip cream- yes!!
author: Jenny Y.

description: Creamy yummiest Chai!! I got the Elephant Vanilla... I highly recommend this. But first the gal/greeter was wonderful, tiny, smart and concise . I love the spacious space. We got a seaweed ball too and it was fresh and tasty . Good staff and cool. Idea to do beer too. I'll be back!!
author: Cecilia D.

description:
Helpful staff recommended Tiger Spice Chai with macadamia milk. Very nice and slightly sweet. Portion came with a refill. Lots of other selection ranging from unsweetened to very spicy with fresh ginger. 
A portion of sales goes to protection of elephant and tiger habitats.
author: Karrot L.

description: I love this place) almond latte is my favorite! )) but I definitely want to try  something with chai)
author: Mariana S.

description:
I love chai tea and am not a coffee drinker at all, so I had bookmarked Chai Bar as a must-try. It's located mid-market and evidence to San Francisco's growing gentrification (they definitely can get away with selling chai tea for about $5-6 and people, like myself will pay it). Anyhow, I ordered their signature (tiger blend) and was quite pleased. The taste was pretty standard, and not too sweet. I liked how they offered a variety of non-dairy milk options (soy, almond, hazelnut, macadamia), though I'm a bit confused why soy (+$1.50) is more than almond (+$0.75). I'd definitely come back to try their other chai teas (matcha chai - yes please. Oh and who could say no to the Steph Curry, especially with the Warriors where they are now?), but definitely as a treat and not an everyday expense!

Another plus, they sell Dutch caramel wafers an will start making their own wafers with a chai blend.
author: Christina C.

description: I tried the chai bar today, for the first time. Super excited to try their well described chai's-i got the elephant iced. When i first got there was in line waiting for someone to take my order. Then, someone not in line was taken first, cashier then asked if i needed something-told him i was actually in line. Finally ordered my medium iced latte (knowing it costed $4.50), but when the cashier ran me up it came out to $5.50. I then kindly reminded him that a medium costed $4.50, he said "yes thats ight, but for our iced drinks there's only one size." Now a dollar doesn't hurt me, but it's confusing so they should really be transparent about it-not just charge people. Then when i finally got my drink, they're really was nothing special about it. i was expecting such a difference-when there was none. It's good to try once, but i wouldn't come back.
author: Alissa O.

description:
What a great find! 
I am fan and here is why. 

1) quality chai - I make my own chai at home and the beverages here has a perfect blend of sweetness and chai. It is easy to make a very bland one or one that is too sweet. WOOT WOOT for great chai!

2) space - come inside and see for yourself. Unlike many cafes in SF, Chai Bar maximized its space added a nice mix of orange and green. 

3) location - conveniently located on Market and 6th street, it would be nice to drop by after brunch from Dottie's to enjoy a nice cup of chai. 

I will be here everyday, David Rio :)
author: Yoojin J.

description: I am super sensitive when it comes to caffeine, and so I don't drink coffee, but I will allow some caffeine in my life. It's really hard for me to cut out tea or tea lattes,   I will make room for it. I love chai lattes, and have had possibly one of the best chai lattes here at Chai Bar... I ordered a Tiger Spice Chai with macadamia nut milk instead of regular milk... For six bucks... A bit pricey, but was worth it? I think so, I wouldn't necessarily spend money like that all the time. But I feel a little better knowing my money goes towards saving the habitats of elephants and tigers. Feel good spending.
author: April D.

description:
Chai Bar is one of the most beautiful looking cafe's I've been to in the city. If I had the option to work from home more frequently, I would sit at Chai Bar all day without hesitation. Long beautiful tables, plentiful counter space, and comfortable seating everywhere. In terms of the chai itself, you have a ton of options. The menu is kind of cute in that every flavor is themed after a safari animal (elephant chai, tiger chai, etc). I've only gone twice since Chai Bar has opened but of the two chai's that I tried, tiger has been my favorite. I am definitely more of a fan of the iced chai over warm, as the warm is not quite hot enough for my liking. One other criticism I have is I feel like some of the drinks here are a bit too sweet. Would love if I had the option to opt for a less sweet chai. It's clear that chai bar is still figuring things out, training baristas, etc., and I am hoping for nothing but their success. Would definitely recommend you check out Chai Bar if you're in the area.

Random aside, but I like that at the register where you order your drink, you're able to pick up a small flyer to read more about David Rio and his inspiration behind Chai Bar. Check it out when you have the chance :)
author: Austin W.

description:
As a fan of Chai, Chai Bar by David Rio has been on my to-do list of places  that I have been meaning to check out. Today was the day! 

They have different chais that range in sweetness and spiciness. It was hard for me to decide since I like both spicy and sweet. The available options would either be more spicy with less sweetener or less spicy with more sweetener. 

Tiger Spice Chai - lightly spiced and moderately sweetened seemed to be a good starter for those that have goldilocks taste buds. Although I am not lactose intolerant, I like to opt for the soy milk option as that is how I like my chai. I was happy with the product. 

A few other options I am curious to try next time:

Bubble chai - choice of chai with boba/tapioca pearls 
Elephant vanilla chai - with dark cocoa and lightly spiced and moderately sweet.

Don't let the chai bar overwhelm you with it's name, they also offer tea and coffee beverages. 

Interestingly enough, Chai Bar offers hazelnut and macadamia nut milk options aside from soy and almond milk.

The atmosphere is chic and hip with hues of orange and brown with plenty of seating.
author: Becky Q.

description:
Deliciously tasty vanilla chai! The restaurant setting is also lovely, with padded seating wrapping around the walls. There was one large table for a group and a couple of smaller ones for pairs. I liked the large bar seating - I waited there for my chai and watched it being made. 

For food, their little rice ball snacks are pretty good. I thought the other items looked expensive but hey, maybe it's super tasty?

Service is nice and speedy. The cashier thoughtfully asked me if I worked locally (you get a 10% discount). The barista saw me waiting and figured I was his customer, so he poured my drink in front of me and handed it to me. Now that's personal service!
author: Apple P.

description: Every drink I've tried here has been delicious. My new favorite (previously elephant vanilla) is chocolate chai, hot and iced. It's a perfect balance of sweet and spicy, the milk is frothy and smooth. I wasn't a fan of chai until I tasted good chai like David Rio brand. The to go cups are really nice quality and design as well. Service is fast and friendly, and I like how they offer to go onigiri and sandwiches that are reasonably priced and taste good. The ambiance of the place itself is comfortable and relaxing, physically clean and spacious. Great place to meet up with friends or do work.
author: Grace C.

description:
Amazing service! I left my phone here and they scrambled to find it for me! 

Highlights: 
- $5 beers for Happy Hour 3-6. 
- Fast wifi- just ask for the password. 
- Nice ambiance
author: Frances C.

description:
The space is beautiful, I found myself sitting by the window, which is GREAT for people watching on Market Street. 

After a trip to India last year, I fell in love with chai. It's become a daily ritual since! 
Back here in the states, David Rio has been one of my go tos. I had been looking forward to the opening of their cafe for quite some time, and now that its finally here, i'm pretty stoked!
author: Sara K.

description: When you first walk in, you can feel how relaxed the people are. They don't slack, though, you get your chai in record time. The staff are smiling, friendly and welcoming. The chai is very good, if prepared on the weak side. I picked up a cub chai and yogurt parfait every morning during my stay here. Both delicious and fresh. The salads look good, too. Spacious, pleasing sitting area and WiFi.
author: Michelle L.

description:
What I like, no, what i LOVE about this place: very friendly staff, spacious seating, and amazing tea (with very large portions)

What I don't like: pretty pricey and the design on the floor gave me a headache.

Would definitely stop in again, mostly because I adored the friendly barista we had.
author: Marilyn M.

description:
Delicious coffee, really hit the spot on a cold night out with the crazies.  Blueberry muffin was tasty.  Great location, felt like a warm cabin full of hipsters working late.

Very cozy.
author: Aaron C.

description: Pretty decent spicy chai here (Boldly Spiced Chai), unsweetened. Not as creamy as some others I've liked more, but how much frothy cream one likes is probably down to taste now. Tried two other chais; "moderately sweet" is actually really sweet, too sweet to enjoy the whole cup unfortunately. Wish they had something in between. Not a bad place to stop over at on the way into work though, and not crowded at all in the morning.
author: Linus W.

description: I'm excited this place is finally open. The space is really open and there are couches and stuff along the walls. I would give the space 4 stars but the Tiger Chai just didn't impress me very much. I prefer my chai to be at least a little spicy, and the Tiger Chai just tasted like milk with a little cinnamon. Maybe I'll try the vegan one next time (it has a little "spicy" sign next to it); I thought about it but I wanted to try their baseline. Also it's a little pricey (says the college student) but that wasn't really surprising. I'll try again!
author: Lauren F.

description:
I have been coming in here every week and maybe 3-4 times a week to work on my school projects. This place is spacious and has free wifi and enough outlets. Louis (manager) is pretty awesome. The very first time I came, he introduced himself and ever since then, he always greets me or stops by where I'm sitting and says hi (he does that for everyone). The rest of the staff are friendly but after being a regular for about 3 months now, they still don't know my name which is the downside. I hope they can try and remember people's names after coming in so often because that shows they care. Besides that, their chai lattes are amazing.
These are the ones I have tried:

Tiger Spice Latte with Almond Milk is absolutely delicious. It's on the sweeter side but not as sweet at Elephant Vanilla Chai. If you have a sweet tooth, I would recommend the Elephant Vanilla Chai with Almond Milk. Cub Chai is on the spicier side which is equally as good but it's not for me. And my regular drink is the Dirty Chai Latte with Tiger Spice and Almond Milk. All of these drinks are amazing HOT or ICED. 

They have happy hour starting at 3PM and they serve Beer on Tap and Wine. You really can't miss this place especially if you're walking on Market street; you will smell the chai before you get to the door.
author: Soo-Lin H.

description: So amazing ! The tiger chai is super refreshing on a hot day and they have an amazing variety of Masubi! Most defiantly love it !
author: Khuyen D.

description: Best chai latte I've had- I got the Bengali tiger (their original) with hazelnut milk. The ranking on the menu indicating the balance of sweet/spicy was SUPER helpful- I like my chai moderately sweet (but not that gross stuff from a box that so many cafes get away with). I was so happy with this drink- hazelnut milk was deliciously smooth and creamy, chai was perfectly sweet and spicy (it was ranked 50/50 on the menu). Overall- delicious, about $5, but I thought it was excellent enough to deserve the price tag. Just wish they had more locations...!!!!
author: Abby M.

description:
i went to david rio's chai bar and paid six dollars for an iced chai.  i love chai.  i even make my own home made chai.  that's why i made a special trip to this chai bar and paid what used to be the price of a sandwich, for an iced tea.  i'm sure at this point it's not difficult to gather that i was not satisfied.  the chai was good but it was not six dollars in a cup worth of good.  

kasa indian truck is better and it's not six dollars.
author: lori s.

description: I LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! Came across it on my way to the mall and low and behold this gem! All different kinds of chai from mild and sweet to gingery and spicy !!! I got the power chai with matcha and get ready for it... MACADAMIA NUT MILK!!! Amazing!!! You must go!!!
author: Brianna L.

description: Cute place on Market. Very spacious and great for studying or relaxing with a friend!
author: Yanni L.

description: Lazy people like to close early and then just rudely turned away while there are still about 20 people sitting in there. Post your hours on Yelp if they have changed. BYE
author: Veronica S.

description: I'm in love with this place. The elephant vanilla is my favorite - with macadamia nut milk!
author: Mark S.

description: I'm super choosy when it comes to my Chai. Almost somewhat like a chai-snob @ every cafe asking "Is it powder, or syrup? Also, what brand. " For years, I settled for mediocre chai until one time I found David Rio's brand. One sip & it was love @ first tastebud. Sooooo...when I heard they were opening a store, I was ecstatic. The tiger spice chai is my favorite. In my opinion, not too sweet/spicy.
