I'm kind of stuck in my ways-- in a sense where if I like a drink or certain dish, I'll probably order the same thing, so I'm not disappointed. However, the last time I visited I tried something new. (Kinda sounds a lot like my life in general right now .) Tried to stay opened minded about the other many flavors they offered and tried the tortoise green tea chai. Definitely a winner, but a little on the sweeter side. In terms of the atmosphere, pretty chill. Wi-if, music, tables and an actual bar. Parking may be the only downfall since it's right on Market St. Regardless, very much worth circling the block 1 or 2 times.
author: Janelle D.

description: The Cub Chai with fresh ginger and black pepper may be my favorite thing in SF right now! So much flavor!
author: Jonas K.

description: Love loved the tiger chai here. I'm fairly picky about chai and really ejoyed this one here. A perfect amount of spice and creaminess although could stand to be a tad bit less sweet. Too bad they charge $5.5 a cup.
author: Amy D.

description:
This place is part of my morning commute. Love the service, love the chai flavors. 

Love the cow juice alternatives (dairy doesn't like me)
Soy,
Macadamia,
Coconut,
Almond,
They probably have more but I can vouch for those alternatives being routinely available.

One star off because the inconsistent food availability and selection is what has me often going elsewhere after I pop in to peek at the food. I still stop here first though.
author: Mallie M.

description: Was pleasantly surprised to find no long line when I went in the morning, I decided to go with a large drip coffee and a freshly baked blueberry muffin. Both were great and I was happy that soy milk wasn't extra. The space is large and clean and I would definitely come back to try their chai next time.
author: John L.

description: Love this place. Amazing chai. Even more amazing service. There was a small problem with my order and they went above and beyond to make it more than right - gave me a refund for my entire order and gave me a free chai coupon!
author: Barrett P.

description:
Went here with my coworkers for our weekly happy hour, since they also serve beer and wine (and sake). I had a beer and some chai and both were tasty and original. The service was amazingly courteous and friendly with an entertaining hipster twist. 

Would probably be a better afternoon chai break kind of place, but it certainly wasn't the worst place we had ever been for happy hour. Chai makes me think of a more cozy environment than Chai Bar's modern appointments, so I'd love to see more couches and comfy chairs, but that's just my opinion.
author: Brittany L.

description: 5 stars because I'm a hardcore supporter of small pop shops/start ups and organic variety! I got the elephant vanilla chai with almond milk! It was absolutely delicious and price was fair for San Francisco. Staff was rude. Girl at the front could be a little more welcoming, but it's a cute ship, clean environment, very relaxing! Will be coming back
author: Laura S.

description:
Seriously!? It's powder and they heat up milk for you. Sooo not worth it! Description says there's fresh ginger in the cub chai, but never saw ginger in there. 

Total rip off
author: Banana B.

description: Very good chai, great music, and an overall relaxing atmosphere. Great place to get some work done (free WiFi!).
author: Trisha D.

description: I finally tried this place out. I had an iced green chai, delicious! The staff was super friendly and welcoming. I can't wait to go back!
author: Cesar R.

description:
I think the chai is OK - the Tiger chai tastes a lot like the Nordstrom chai and that powdered brand you can buy in the grocery store, not so much like an Indian masala chai I was hoping for.

They also have packaged salads available and I tried the kale with chicken, that was pretty good especially with the squeezed lemon.

Ambiance is relaxed and has a variety of seating, good for people coming alone or in twos.
author: Lauren T.

description: The cafe itself is lovely.   Beautiful geometric tile floors, comfortable seating & nicely furnished interior.  A great place to relax in an otherwise gritty stretch of Market Street.  If those weren't reasons enough to visit, they have excelled at making Chai teas into an art form.   I can't recall having a more delicious Chai than the Tiger Spice Chai I ordered.  Another fantastic unique find in the city.
author: Christopher P.

description: They make an amazing stroopwafel which is a hard thing to find in the US. Randomly tried their food though Eat Club, and will definitely be making a trip to the store for some chai now :D
author: Katherine R.

description: I come here regularly for a dirty chai with tiger chai. Love the menu here, and the staff is wonderful! Highly recommend for happy hour as well.
author: Tatiana G.

description: I'm no chai expert, but Elephant Vanilla Chai with Macadamia Nut milk is absolutely AMAZING. I took a sip the second I got my order, which came in less than 2 minutes, and the temperature was perfect. No tongue burning where you lose your taste buds to enjoy your drink. The setting is unique and beautiful, so happy I tried this and would love to come back to try the rest of the menu.
author: Connie L.

description: This place is amazing! The interior is very cozy and seems like it would be great for getting work done or being creative. The chai themselves are delicious. I had the Tiger Spice Chai which was hot and so flavorful. The owner david is an incredible guy who really cares that each customer gets the best experience. The second drink I had was an iced chocolate chai which was mighty refreshing. Did I mention they have macadamia milk? Tastes great. Would definitely come again
author: Daniel M.

description: Chai Latte was awesome. The toilet was clean. However, my table was a bit dirty. Acceptable!
author: Darm T.

description:
I really want to like this place. It's nice and spacious, is right next to my office, and has a great combo and selection of coffee, chai and beer, but the service had been disappointing. I've been here before when things were a little rough around the edges, but today was the worst and prompted this review. The guy working the register was very confused about my bagel order - if it was supposed to be plain or everything, and if it was supposed to be toasted or not, and what kind of topping I wanted. This was immediately after I asked for "an everything bagel, toasted with cream cheese." After a bit of repeating myself so he could finally getting my order right, my latte came out quickly. About 15 minutes later my bagel finally arrived. The wrong bagel: plain instead of everything. Normally it's a simple mistake and I would let it go, but my previous experiences here combined with the initial confusion, plus the delay behind just one other customer waiting for food, was really unfortunate and doesn't bode well for this place.

I'm only giving 3 stars instead of 2 because I think they can get better, especially since the latte was good and the space is great. But they gotta fix the service and food situation!
author: Derek J.

description: I absolutely love this place! Stopped in today to grab some onigiri (best in the city) and a cup of tea, and everything was delicious. I regularly get the gluten free pastries (to die for!) as well as drip coffee and chai, which are excellent. And the best part is, they have an amazing selection of wines and beer on tap - yes! Great vibe and a fantastic addition to the neighborhood.  5 stars!
author: Stephanie J.

description: HANDS DOWN BEST drink I have ever had in any type of coffee shop. Their Tiger chai latte is absolutely amazing.
author: Annie C.

description: Chai was made from a powder mix and tasted like a kids sweet drink...any drink over $5 should be handmade.
author: SectionZ F.

description: Just another gleaming 5-star review for this well-deserving, all-class establishment. The Cub Chai with spicy ginger and black pepper (almond milk optional) was just chai purrfection. I'm going to have to find a way to get here some time soon to hang out in the extremely inviting space. I love that this is Market Street now, and when I experience places like this, it makes me not mind upscale cafes one bit. This isn't your cookie-cutter hipster joint. It's priced fairly, looks sharp, and serves up a quality without a confusing, elaborate menu. Excellent job, tigers. Love the looks of the food too. I plan to bite into one of those onigiri sushi contraptions you have the next time I go in, and I hope you keep those around.
author: Jared R.

description: Terrible service I was told to leave by the manager because I was ordering food after using the restroom after I was told it was fine. Used to come here all the time till the new manager changed the good vibes the place had. Bald chubby guy who sits by the beer
author: Steven G.

description:
First time I've ever had chai and wow. the tortoise 
green tea chai was amazing. great location with comfortable seating and layout making experience enjoyable
author: Matthew N.

description: The best Chai I've ever had - Can't wait to try more of the menu! I definitly recommend the spicy Chai with Cardemom and hazelnut milk. Genius.
author: Lindsay G.

description: Amazing! I love the Orca chai with hazelnut latte... Best chai I ever had! Now that the cold has arrived to San Francisco I really love to hang out there with a warm creamy chai :) people behind the counter are SUPER nice and it's a great working space
author: Sara C.

description: This spacious, aromatic cafe/bar is an ideal spot for getting work done and/or catching up with friends. I've had the Tiger Spice Chai with whole milk and really enjoyed it. I'm by no means a chai connoisseur, but this is on par with The Chai Cart further down Market St. As a side note, I REALLY enjoy the cafe's choice in alternative music (e.g. The Strokes, The Shins, Band of Horses). I admit that I was humming along to the music and not getting much work done.
author: Jeremy S.

description: Love their Chai and blueberry muffin yums.
author: Christina C.

description: Very cool place! The chai drinks are delicious. Good vibes! I could sit here all day!
author: Debra L.

description: Took refuge from the rain here last week. Had the dirty chai and it was delicious! Had large tables and plenty of outlets for studying.
author: Cristina V.

description: besides offering yummy chai, you're also supporting great causes! the space is chic and spacious with lots of comfy seats. there's outdoor seating for when you feel like enjoying the eccentricity that is market st. the drink i ordered, cub chai, was fragrant and flavorful. it was like an exotic version of the PSL. if you think chai is only so-so, that's probably because you've only tried it from tea bags(guilty). this will make you reconsider your new drink of choice.
author: Melissa Y.

description:
When I first put boots to the ground in San Francisco I walked by this place on market and knew I had to go in...it just looked so freaking cool and a chai place where vegan is on the menu- sold!
It did not disappoint! It's got more non dairy options than dairy options!  The cub chai is the perfect spicy sweet chai- that bite that is missing from your run of the mill coffee shop chai which just hits a sweet cinnamon spot. This has it all covered and has a version of the cub chai (forgot the name) that is unsweetened and all spice. 
The atmosphere has wonderful natural light and I love the black and white tile work on the floor. It's open and has the perfect ambient noise level. It looks very hip, but the clientele are random, not hipster. Very unpretentious.
The staff is very warm and helpful in suggesting your perfect cup of chai. It's like philz for chai. They work fast too, my drinks are always out before I finish downing a glass of their fancy lemon mint cucumber water.
I've only had the "ferry building" mushroom rice square but it's now a must grab every time I go in. The wrapper is really fun to unwrap, I don't get to say that often, it's packaged in a way that the sticky rice and mushrooms are separately wrapped from the nori, but after you unwrap and pull the sides you magically have a crispy nori wrapped rice square. It's fun, too much fun. Or I'm just simple. Decide for yourself, either way the chai is great.
author: Sarah F.

description:
I am so impressed! It's a really short walk from BART and from Union Square and a nice reprieve from the other busy shops and cafes. There's a good variety of drinks and something for everyone- green tea, vanilla, chocolate, iced, toppings, etc. When they poured the drinks, they made it a visual experience- setting out the (very cool!) tea cups and pouring it there in front of us. I had the Elephant Vanilla and my friend had the Chocolate Assam Frost- both were amazing. Every sip was indulgent! 

The store itself is very spacious with window seats, couch-style seating, booths and tables, as well as bar seats and outdoor seating. I feel that they could squeeze in a couple more tables to increase the amount of people. Also, the staff didn't seem to know the products too well which made ordering a little less than smooth.

Good place to hang out, have a casual meeting, or catch up with friends. Due to how quick the tables get taken up, though, I wouldn't count on it to be a good study spot. I would definitely make a detour to try this place!
author: Karen J.

description: LUIS made my first time here the absolute best experience ever!!! I have never witnessed customer service like it before... He made my best friend and I feel so special as first-timers, and we were blown away by the care, quality of chai, variety, and layout of the space (a bar as well as comfy booths with pillows!). I live all the way in Davis, but I'm honestly considering making the 1.5 drive every week to go study here... It is that good. This Chai Bar is absolute genius, and I'm absolutely obsessed with Luis! Order a drink from him and you won't regret it. I've been craving a chai ever since (and none of the coffeeshops near me compare)!
author: Heather S.

description: I had a cup of their signature Tiger Spice Chai, and WOW! I was surely in Chai latte heaven! Steamy, and creamy, with just the right amount of spice and sweetness. It was absolutely lovely. All I can compare it to is a warm hug. The really good hugs where you don't want to let go. I can't wait to come back here to try their other beautiful creations.
author: Kristina B.

description: Very friendly service! Good chai and coffee.
author: Hamrez S.

description: Went on a Saturday afternoon, and there was plenty of space available. The seating area was very comfortable, with several lounge pillows available. I enjoyed my chocolate chai, which was well-made. I definitely recommend this place as a stop to rest your feet after walking around a lot in the downtown SF area.
author: Sherry S.

description: Chai-Mazing and an absolutely adorable and spacious space. Perfect place to grab a warm drink, snack, and do some work in their comfy booths. So happy this area is slowly getting gems like this.
author: Paisley P.

description: I LOVE this place!  I am a huge fan of chai and super psyched when I learned they were opening in my building.  Finally, a place that is completely chai!  My fave is the Green Tortoise Tea Chai with Almond Milk.  Not only is the chai amazing, but so are the staff.  They're so friendly and make you feel at home.  They make an effort to get to know the regulars and I'm usually greeted by name and some of the baristas know my order.  I'm a creature of habit sometimes and when I find something I love, I tend to be unwilling to change.  Can't say enough about this place!  Great chai.  Great service.  What more can you ask for?
author: Kim J.

description: I'm used to drinking green tea so the signature chai selections offered here was unique and different. I ordered the Elephant Vanilla Chai with Macademia Nut Milk and it's amazing, although im not sure if its because of the milk or the chai. Definitely a chai-changing experience for a tea lover :-)
author: Rachel C.

description:
It's great if they make your drink right. I'd say they get it wrong about 50% of the time. But they're quick fixes and it's preeeetty tasty/convenient. 

FYI they don't make their drinks super hot (probably for liability reasons, thank you Liebeck vs. McDonald's) so make sure to specify your desired temp.

Quiche Lorraine is the bomb.
author: Adrienne H.

description: I've been here a couple of times now since I recently noticed how close it is to my work, and I'm becoming a fan. It's spacious enough, has friendly staff, good pre-packaged lunch items and they make delicious coffee drinks. Their dirty chai is my favorite. I'll be back!
author: HM N.

description: I love that they have hazelnut milk!  As a lactose intolerant person, it's great to see a bunch of non-dairy options.  The flavor of their chais compares favorably with almost anywhere else I've been, although it may just be that I'm grooving on the other milk options.
author: Drew H.

description: Yum! This place is another nice addition to mid-market. Just down the street from my office, I popped in here today to check it out with a coworker. She got the vegan power-chai option, and I had the sugar free vanilla flamingo chai with almond milk. No lie, it tasted just like a dunkaroo. After I came back from my 90's kid flashback I reveled in the glory of how delicious it was. People who don't love super sweet things may want to try one of the more spicy versions. What a treat! The decor / ambiance is very cool too- great space for meetings (at least until it gets popular and crowded!)
author: Eliza D.

description: Amazingly helpful, personable, interesting staff, delicious chai (go BOLD if you aren't faint of heart / don't have a sweet tooth) and a spacious and relaxing atmosphere to work or hang in. The green tea is amazing too. Love this spot!
author: Mercy B.

description: I came here with a few friends one day, and I'm definitely a fan of the environment and the atmosphere. I ordered an iced chai drink that came with boba, and it was refreshingly good. There are a ton of other selections on the menu in terms of chai tea, and also a selection of ready made food to order as well. There are a lot of seating options as well, and I saw several parties working on their laptops and studying. Overall, definitely a cool place that merits another visit!
author: Daniel H.

description: I went here for the first time today and wasn't let down. It's clean, not too loud, has great drink options (I loved the chocolate!), offers the seaweed-wrapped rice that my husband loves, and is a really good option for meeting people who work in the mid-Market area.
author: Michelle G.

description: Best cafe addition to Market St in a while! I've been addicted to its onigiri (especially the goodness of the "forbidden city" spam has taken me by surprise)! I was not a huge chai person before discovering this gem of a cafe - I go for the "dirty chai" with Tiger Spice chai every time being the coffee person I am. Wonderful work spaces with sockets and inviting wooden tables!
author: Jan L.

description: I went with the very conventional and popular Tiger Spice Chai blend, but it is an old favorite of mine so I had to go with it for my first visit to Chai Bar.  I went with the almond milk this visit, but I have to try the macadamia nut milk next time as well as the Cub Chai that's lightly sweetened versus the Tiger Chai which is fully sweetened.  Croissant was fine, but nothing too exciting or extraordinary.  The space had a great vibe and I loved the decor overall.  Great addition to Market Street and I love the dedication and celebration of chai overall - having to go to so many coffee houses with friends and sip on weak tea (if they even have tea on the menu, much less chai) because of the "espresso or bust" attitude, it was nice to drag others along to show that there is a world outside of coffee.
author: Grace S.

description: This place is heaven! I am a big chai lover and was super excited to try this place out. Their ambience and decor is inviting, warm and a breath of fresh air for the area. Their staff is also extremely cordial and very helpful. I am currently in love with their Orca Chai and their house made pastries/salads. The blueberry muffin is amazing and very filling. I know the staff mentioned they will be having beer and wine in the next week which I think will be a great, chill happy hour place for local companies. Definitely recommend this place, you will not regret it :)
author: Alicia M.

description: As a chai lover, I became super excited knowing there was a cafe devoted to this wonderful spicy elixir. I knew I had to try when I was in the City again, which was this past weekend. When I walked into the Chai Bar, I was more than pleasantly surprised by the beautiful design and openness of the place, especially since around the corner from the place was filled with the smell of urine. You gotta love the City! Anyway, I knew I had to order the Stephen Curry drink even though it sounded odd, but I tend to like to try unique things. The "chai-rista" (I made this up but feel free to use) described the drink as tasting like an Arnold Palmer with chai spices and that it was a refreshing summer drink, so I went for it - and it tasted exactly like she described! My son ordered the Chocolate Chai, and he loved it! The other great thing about this bar is that they have all these small snacks from the savory to the sweet to accompany your drinks. We ordered a handful of their rice rolls, and they were all tasty - we tried the mushroom, Spam, and the tuna salad one. They were all delicious! As for dessert, we had the chocolate covered macaroon, and it was big and tasty! Customer service was excellent. The chai-rista even came around to our table later to give us a sample of a the Tiger Chai with almond milk, which was frothy & yummy. If you love Chai, good food, and a nice place to hang for a bit then this place has to be on your To Do List now.
author: Kiki C.

description: I am so glad I walked right instead of left and ended up here. My new favorite. I have never met lovelier people in a cafe. I mean that from the heart. Everyone was friendly, helpful, kind. My drink - chai and espresso smells amazing and tastes delicious. And the lemon ginger scone - yum! And wifi for next time when I'm not heading out.
author: Monica P.

description: I have been visiting the Chai Bar since December 2015. I really like their coffee. It is soooo much better than the local chains. Of course, their specialty is Chai. I had one Chai Tea so far. It was excelent! I will try more and review their tea drinks. I have had their Quiche a few times. The Quiche is light and fuffy; a great texture and seasoning. It is made in house. I do recommend the Quiche. The staff have always been friendly. The manager Luis is awesome! In the evenings they have hosted live music and social events. If you need to plug-in, they have accomidations. I highly recommend the Chai Bar!
author: sam n.

description: Cool vibe. Solid wifi. Lots of choices as far as chai goes. I'm by no means a chai expert but I got s chai latte thing and it was really really good. Seemed like mostly techie startup people were here, but hey it's SoMa. Also, they have beer.
author: Nikolas P.

description:
Pretty good stuff here! I came in after seeing it while I was on the 5. I decided to take a stop and try it out for lunch. 
I LOVE chai lattes, so I was really excited that they had a place dedicated to chai. I got the Tiger Spice Chai with almond milk. It was so delicious. However, I tired to order a salad, and was disheartened to hear that they only had prepackaged food available, none of which seemed appetizing. Bummer :(
I came with the intention to get work done, and I couldn't figure out how to get the wifi going. However, I didn't reach out to one of the employees, so I'll do that next time. I ended up just sitting for a little, which isn't too bad.
Also, the cafe itself is really spacious and has plenty of room for sitting. Customer service was ok. The guy taking my order wasn't friendly, and seemed new. I have experienced better service before. The barista seemed nice enough though. 
I might give this place another try :)
author: Kiki C.

description: What a great addition to mid-market! I recommend the Steph Curry (yeah, that's a drink)!
author: Tim S.

description: $5 for a cup of powdered drink mix? Not to mention the requisite powdered drink aftertaste. Bleh.
author: Julia D.

description: My brother & I stopped by this chai bar on a chilly November night about an hour before close. It wasn't crowded & we were excited by so many chai options! We decided on the elephant chai (vanilla) and we were glad we did - delicious!! There was also a wine and beer selection which I thought was cool although I didn't try it. The location was a bit weird, away from the main area and closer to tenderloin which was a bit sketchy at 7pm in the dark.
author: Becky T.

description: Ginger and black pepper chai is a consistent dream of mine.  It's the menu here as the Cub Chai.  Hazelnut milk available--so friggin' lovely!
author: Imma D.

description: Great place to spend a couple of hours working. Spacious, comfy sofas, great chai and super-friendly staff. Recommended!
author: Donnie L.

description: The tiger spice is just as great as coupa cafe's tiger spice latte.
author: Amin S.

description: Really really good chai!!!!! I love that they donate money from each sale towards saving endangered tigers and elephants, and the drinks are fantastic!
author: Adina V.

description: I've had a lot of different chai in my lifetime and nothing comes as close to David Rio's chai! It's a tad bit pricey for me but if I could I would order a cup everyday!
author: Yuliana C.

description: The most delicious chai I have ever had! The prices are a bit above market, but the drinks are delicious. This also looks like it would be a great place to camp out with a laptop.
author: Eric H.

description: Rude staff.. iced Chai was full.of ice.. after 3 sips the drink was gone. The tea didn't taste very good.. Don't waste your bucks here.. no warm welcome Great idea.. just needs some tweeks and customer service skills training and maybe it will last..
author: Michellejazzy A.

description: I  finally made over to try their chai.  I know it's my fault and picked the signature tea with the description that it is sweetened, for me it's too sweet.  I am going back to try the spicy and less sweet chai.
author: pochini m.

description: This is my favorite chai in the city. Their signature Tiger Spice Chai is my favorite but I also like the Tortoise Green Tea Chai. Nice selection of milks including whole, almond, and macadamia. Any of their drinks are sure to pair nicely with one of their several scones or other pastries. The bar has a good layout with many comfortable seating options. I recommend stopping in for a drink on your way to work!
author: Kevin S.

description: Clean, simple, comfortable and delicious. I was having a bad day and was happily comforted by the lovely staff who introduced me to a new world of chai. I recommend everyone to try this place
author: Brandon G.

description: I am a huge Chai snob so I had to check this place out. The decor is nice and simple, they keep changing it every time I've been in. The staff are very friendly and helpful and I like that they have several menus with explanations of the Chai. I've ordered the Power Chai and the Original and they are good. I'm impressed but I won't give it 5 stars because it's not the best Chai I've ever had. The spice mix is just slightly off, not sure how, but with tweaks it could become an awesome chai. Still super cool a place like this exists!
author: Anneli V.

description: So so good! I loved enjoying my iced chai on a hot day! The interior of the chai bar is really awesome, they have outside tables, and the staff is really nice. I also like how they show how versatile the chai is by putting it in food and pastries.
author: Josie C.

description:
I dont always drink chai but when i do...its masala chai from an indian restaurant and that's the kind i like...strong tea and spices with just enough milk and sweetness to my liking.  I tried the boxed stuff but those have always been too sweet. So sometimes i get the bagged tea. 

Chai bar though uses powder which means there's already dairy in the mix and then they add more dairy so it's milked down by all that milky milk and some hot water. And if you get a flavored non original chai, say the elephant vanilla or the green tea, it's going to be super sweet. Super sweet frothy milk with a hint chai spice but it aint spicey. I mean, i kind of like it, its ok but wished the tea was strong. The Tiger had more tea flavor but it was all still pretty milked down.
Definitely not what i was expecting from this chai bar. I liked the Steph Curry though. It's not chai but it's made there...not with powder. And it tastes pretty good. Ambiance is cool.
author: Mila B.

description: Best chai tea. Lots of choices. The place is Spacious - perfect for studying/work. Prices are on the higher end.
author: Chulin G.

description: Nice space but I found the chai cloyingly sweet (after letting the person taking my order know that I didn't want something very sweet, she recommended the signature chai, that was a mistake). Threw out most of it. Not a goto for a $4.50 drink imho. Food looked kind of interesting, maybe I'll give it a try at some point.
author: Avi W.

description: I have celiac disease and bought a gluten-free muffin here that made me sick. I ate nothing for more than an hour before that and nothing for more than an hour after, which makes me pretty certain that Chai Bar is the culprit. This place is super trendy and looks very cool but definitely not worth getting sick. Please beware if you are actually gluten-intolerant like me.
author: P M.

description: This place is really overpriced. The teas are not vegan, even if you order them with non-dairy milk. This is a point that should be noted much more clearly on the menu because no one would assume an almond milk chai would have dairy in it.
author: Sophia L.

description: Cool place. Came for the onigiri, stayed for the ambiance, and the nice padded booths.
author: Dion G.

description: I wanted to try this place. It looks great and I love chai. Door was locked and I could not come in at 4 45 on a sat. The published closing time is 5pm.
author: Leighton R.

description: Had the Tiger Spice Chai -- best chai I've ever had. Got it with macadamia nut milk, and it was smooth and creamy. Flavor was rich without being too sweet.
author: Damaris O.

description: Their Chai tea puts starbuck's Chai to shameeee. It is however a little more pricey but the quality is definitely noticeable.
author: Juan A.

description: This place was amazing!! The Tiger Chai is to kill for. A client of mines told me that she worked here and to stop by. When I walked into the shop, an employee introduced the menu to me and told me about the different drinks they offer. I grabbed a warm Tiger Chai and added a few pinches of cinnamon. And MY GOD how every sip tasted like the first one. And the service was on point! I ordered the 12oz and she poured the chai into a 12oz cup, and handed me the pot with the rest of the chai to take to my table with me. Talk about a refill! Lol!
author: Mohsen M.

description: Absolutely delicious, and with a very nice ambiance. Only catch I found is the price: $5.50 is rather on the high end for a (large) cup of chai. Nevertheless, I think I'll be back!
author: Mark R.

description: I wrote my original review for this place a while back after my first visit. Must reiterate, this place is awesome! Even the food and sweets are awesome. I'm a regular now!
author: Serena X.

description: This is a great place to relax and have excellent tea! The staff are diverse and fun, and work hard to provide great service.  I drink more matcha than Chai, and have had a range of matcha brands.  Trust me when I say, they have the best matcha available. Its pure matcha, no additives at all.  Very smooth and no bitter taste, very bright green.  They sell most of their chai tea online, but not the matcha, which was a bummer.  But I ask, and they happily agreed to ship to me. So now I get David Rio matcha shipped directly to me.  Thank you and keep up the great service.
author: Ken A.

description: It's not actually authentic chai (it's not even all that close). Probably should have realized that when I read the name "David Rio" or saw a picture of a tiger on the cup. If you're looking for real chai, try the Chai Cart that's on Market St.
author: Mo K.

description: Whoa. I'm in here right now, and this might be my new favorite cafe. I LOOOVEEE CHAI and its SO cute. Only issues - no bike parking up front, and tables are a little high if you intend to co-work.
author: Alexander T.

description: I was greeted at the door by a delightful young lady. She presented me with a menu and explained my options. I ordered a Cub Chai and it was delicious and hot. Chai Bar has a relaxing atmosphere with a variety of seating arrangements. Background music is pleasant. The real reason I came to get a chai was because I heard Chai Bar has original art displayed all across the side wall. Loved it!  The chai latte was awesome as well! Definitely coming back!
author: Karen P.

description: How the hell do they get the perfect temperature?? Elephant vanilla chai is my new favorite drink :) I can't say much for service because I usually get it to go, but they're always friendly and fast enough to keep me coming back. Love it!
author: Kaitlyn B.

description: Horrible table seating configuration. What were they thinking?  Long table for 12 against a wall so of course people sit at each end so no way to access the middle seats. Another table for six with one person taking it over. Was this set up as a family style restaurant?   Center has no seats so lots of empty space not being used.
author: Dean P.

description: I got a chai that was way overpriced and tasted weird/synthetic.  I just didn't get it.  I like traditional chai that tastes super fresh, but hey, it must be popular for a reason.
author: James T.

description: I was disappointed. I expected a chai bar to make chai freshly every day, from whole spices. I ordered their "cub" chai with almond milk, and was surprised when the barista took out a bottle of packaged cold tea, heated it with steam and added milk. As a result, the spices taste stale. I wouldn't go back. Samovar makes far better chai.
author: Ari W.

description: I'm gonna take down this post and give them another chance after speaking with the manager I hope they live up to the convo
author: Orlando V.

description: Very spacious cafe with a lot of chai tea varieties. I had the Elephant chai with macadamia nut milk and it is so delicious. Not overly spiced and the nut milk ties in really well with the spice and vanilla from the tea. Definitely will be coming back again.
author: Tammy C.

description: Fantastic place. Innovative drinks. Good service. Yes, it's not standard chai, but that's the point. A welcome addition to this part of SF.
author: Anil P.

description: This place just opened on market. I walk by it every day on the way to work. The chai is really good, and the white chocolate cranberry scone is one of my favorites.
author: Torsten L.
